classes.name: BBjServletData
classes.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, the BBjServletData object allows your program to register callbacks for incoming web requests.

When the webserver first receives a request registered with the BBjServletRegistry, an interpreter will be started with the registered BBjAppConfig. That application then registers handlers for callback events. BBjServletData provides a handle to the internal configuration for registering callbacks. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjservletdata/bbjservletdata.htm)

methods.name: clearCallback
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method clears the handler for the event 
 type.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjservletdata/BBjServletData_clearCallback.htm)

methods.name: setCallback
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method registers a custom object as a callback 
 handler.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjservletdata/BBjServletData_setCallback.htm)

methods.name: setCallback
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method registers a custom object as a callback 
 handler.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjservletdata/BBjServletData_setCallback.htm)

classes.name: BBjInterpreterServer
classes.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, the BBjInterpreterServer provides methods to execute on the server's machine in a thin client environment. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjinterpreterserver/bbjinterpreterserver.htm)

methods.name: serverExec
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method executes a command on the server machine.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjinterpreterserver/bbjinterpreterserver_serverexec.htm)

methods.name: serverExec
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method executes a command on the server machine.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjinterpreterserver/bbjinterpreterserver_serverexec.htm)

methods.name: getServerBuildDate

methods.name: getServerIPAddress
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the server's IP address.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjinterpreterserver/bbjinterpreterserver_getserveripaddress.htm)

methods.name: getServerBBjVersion
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the version of BBj running on the server.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjinterpreterserver/bbjinterpreterserver_getserverbbjversion.htm)

methods.name: getServerName
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the name of the server machine.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjinterpreterserver/bbjinterpreterserver_getservername.htm)

methods.name: getServerJavaVersion
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the java version on which BBjServices is running.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjinterpreterserver/bbjinterpreterserver_getserverjavaversion.htm)

methods.name: getServerOSName
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the name of the server machine's operating system.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjinterpreterserver/bbjinterpreterserver_getserverosname.htm)

methods.name: getServerOSVersion
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the version of the server machine's operating system.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjinterpreterserver/bbjinterpreterserver_getserverosversion.htm)

classes.name: BBjServletConfiguration
classes.docu:
In BBj 15.00 and higher, BBj Servlets can be programmatically configured though the AdminAPI. This class is used to configure a BBjServlet that will be automatically deployed within a BBjJettyContextConfiguration. The configuration comprises 3 elements
  • NAME - will form part of the URL
  • PROGRAM - the source file containing the servlet code
  • CONFIG - the BBj configuration file to use during execution
[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjservletconfiguration/BBjServletConfiguration.htm)

methods.name: setConfig
methods.docu: In BBj 15.0 and higher, this method sets the name of the config file used in executing a BBj Servlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjservletconfiguration/BBjServletConfiguration_setConfig.htm)

methods.name: getConfig
methods.docu: In BBj 15.00 and higher, this method gets the name of the config file used in executing a BBj Servlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjservletconfiguration/BBjServletConfiguration_getConfig.htm)

methods.name: setProgram
methods.docu: In BBj 15.00 and higher, this method sets the name of the program file used in executing a BBj Servlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjservletconfiguration/BBjServletConfiguration_setProgram.htm)

methods.name: getProgram
methods.docu: In BBj 15.00 and higher, this method gets the name of the program file used in executing a BBj Servlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjservletconfiguration/BBjServletConfiguration_getProgram.htm)

methods.name: getName
methods.docu: In BBj 15.00 and higher, this method gets the name of a BBj Servlet and forms part of the URL. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjservletconfiguration/BBjServletConfiguration_getName.htm)

classes.name: BBjResourceUrl
classes.docu:
In BBj 12.0 and higher, a BBjResourceUrl uniquely identifies a resource 
 used by a BUI application.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjresourceurl/BBjResourceUrl.html)

methods.name: getAppUrl
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the unique URL corresponding to this resource.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjresourceurl/BBjResourceUrl_getAppUrl.html)

methods.name: getMimeType
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the MIME type of this resource.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjresourceurl/BBjResourceUrl_getMimeType.html)

methods.name: getSourceFileName
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the filename from which the contents of this URL were obtained.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjresourceurl/BBjResourceUrl_getSourceFileName.html)

methods.name: setMimeType
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this methods sets the MIME type of this resource. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjresourceurl/BBjResourceUrl_setMimeType.html)

methods.name: setSourceFileName
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets the file from which the contents of this URL were obtained. This method will re-read the file given here and cause BBjResourceUrl::getAppUrl to return a new value if the file contents differ. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjresourceurl/BBjResourceUrl_setSourceFileName.html)

classes.name: BBjFileUpload
classes.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, BBjFileUpload contains 
all of the information related to files uploaded to a Servlet.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjfileupload/BBjFileUpload.htm)

methods.name: getFieldName
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns the name of the HTML element posted to the servlet with a BBjFileUpload object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjfileupload/BBjFileUpload_getFieldName.htm)

methods.name: getTempName
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method gets the full name and path location for the temporary file has been stored in a BBjFileUpload object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjfileupload/BBjFileUpload_getTempName.htm)

methods.name: getContentType
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns the mime type of the uploaded file in a BBjFileUpload object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjfileupload/BBjFileUpload_getContentType.htm)

methods.name: getContentLength
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns the length (in bytes) of the file uploaded in a BBjFileUpload object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjfileupload/BBjFileUpload_getContentLength.htm)

methods.name: getOriginalName
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns the original file name from a BBjFileUpload object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjfileupload/BBjFileUpload_getOriginalName.htm)

classes.name: BBjPrinter
classes.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, a BBjPrinter object allows the user to select a printer and start printing. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjprint/bbjprinter/bbjprinter.htm)

methods.name: getForm
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method obtains a BBjForm object for the currently selected printer. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjprint/bbjprinter/bbjprinter_getform.htm)

methods.name: setNative
methods.docu: In BBj 15.12 and higher, this method sets whether or not the native printer driver is used.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjprint/bbjprinter/BBjPrinter_setNative.htm)

methods.name: setAttributes
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method sets the javax.print.attribute.PrintRequest attributes for documents. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjprint/bbjprinter/bbjprinter_setattributes.htm)

methods.name: getAttributes
methods.docu: Obtains the user set of javax.print.attribute.PrintRequest attributes for the documents. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjprint/bbjprinter/bbjprinter_getattributes.htm)

classes.name: BBjRuntime
classes.docu:
In BBj 9.0 and higher, BBjRuntime provides methods through which a program 
 may interact with its runtime environment.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjruntime/bbjruntime.htm)

methods.name: doGC
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method causes the JVM to do a garbage collection.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjruntime/bbjruntime_dogc.htm)

methods.name: getBBjStack
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of BBjStackElement. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjruntime/bbjruntime_getbbjstack.htm)

methods.name: getBBjStackTrace
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method returns a string representing the BBj stack trace.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjruntime/bbjruntime_getbbjstacktrace.htm)

methods.name: getDebugState
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method returns whether the debug state of the current interpreter is on.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjruntime/bbjruntime_getdebugstate.htm)

methods.name: getMemStatString
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method returns a string containing information about the current memory usage of the JVM.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjruntime/bbjruntime_getmemstatstring.htm)

methods.name: getClientMemoryString
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns a string containing information about the current 
memory usage of the client JVM.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjruntime/BBjRuntime_getClientMemoryString.htm)

methods.name: isClientInServerJVM
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method returns whether the client is running in the same JVM as the server.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjruntime/bbjruntime_isclientinserverjvm.htm)

methods.name: isDVKLicenseActive
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method returns whether BBjServices is using a DVK (development kit) license.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjruntime/bbjruntime_isdvklicenseactive.htm)

methods.name: setDebugState
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method sets the debug state of the current interpreter.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjruntime/bbjruntime_setdebugstate.htm)

methods.name: isConsoleInteractive
methods.docu: In BBj 13.0 and higher, this method returns whether the console in this BBj session is capable of providing a READY prompt to the user. If this method returns true, if the program executes an ESCAPE or if the program encounters an uncaught error, it will attempt to print the READY prompt, subject to the constraints defined by STBL("!CONEXIT"). If this method returns false, executing an ESCAPE or encountering an uncaught error will cause this BBj session to terminate.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjruntime/bbjruntime_isconsoleinteractive.htm)

classes.name: BBjBuiNoneCloseAction
classes.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, the BBjBuiNoneCloseAction object provides an interface to configure no action on termination of a BUI or DWC application.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiNoneCloseAction/BBjBuiNoneCloseAction.htm)

methods.name: getActionType
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns an integer constant identifying the type of this close action (ACTION_NONE). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiNoneCloseAction/BBjBuiNoneCloseAction_getActionType.htm)

methods.name: getActionTypeString
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns an string constant identifying the type of this close action (ACTION_NONE). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiNoneCloseAction/BBjBuiNoneCloseAction_getActionTypeString.htm)

classes.name: BBjConfig
classes.docu:
A BBjConfig object provides programmatic access to some configuration 
 items.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig.htm)

methods.name: getCommandLineObject
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjCommandLineObject.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_getcommandlineobject.htm)

methods.name: getCommandLineObject
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjCommandLineObject.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_getcommandlineobject.htm)

methods.name: getCompatibilitySetting
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method retrieves !COMPAT values from STBL() functions. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_getcompatibilitysetting.htm)

methods.name: getConfigFileName
methods.docu: In BBj 2.02 and higher, this method returns the name of the configuration file used by the current Interpreter session.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_getconfigfilename.htm)

methods.name: getCurrentCommandLineObject
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the current session's BBjCommandLineObject.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_getcurrentcommandlineobject.htm)

methods.name: getOptionSetting
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method retrieves !OPTIONS values from STBL() functions. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_getoptionsetting.htm)

methods.name: getSuppressErrorsOnClientObjVoidMethods
methods.docu: In BBj 8.0 and higher, this method returns a value indicating whether the Interpreter waits for completion of ClientObject methods that have void return type. If the Interpreter does not wait for completion then any exception that is generated on the client side during the method execution will not generate an error in the users program. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_getsuppresserrorsonclientobjvoidmethods.htm)

methods.name: isClientCentric
methods.docu:
In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the client centric SETOPTS bit (8,$08$).

  [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_isclientcentric.htm)

methods.name: isReleaseOnLostConnection
methods.docu:
In BBj 2.01 and higher, this method returns 
a boolean value that indicates whether the interpreter session will be 
terminated immediately if the client side of a thin client connection 
dies unexpectedly.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/BBjConfig_isReleaseOnLostConnection.htm)

methods.name: makeEmptyAppConfig
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjAppConfig object, which can be used to build and publish a BUI BBjApplication. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/BBjConfig_makeEmptyAppConfig.htm)

methods.name: notifyUserOnInternalError
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method controls whether the interpreter notifies the user when it encounters an internal !ERROR=255. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_notifyuseroninternalerror.htm)

methods.name: releaseOnLostConnection
methods.docu: In BBj 2.01 and higher, this method controls whether to terminate the Interpreter session immediately if the client side of a thin client connection dies unexpectedly.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_releaseonlostconnection.htm)

methods.name: requireAllSendMsgResponses
methods.docu: This method controls whether the Interpreter waits for a response from certain SENDMSG functions before proceeding with the next program statement.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_requireallsendmsgresponses.htm)

methods.name: setClientCentric
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method sets the SETOPTS bit 8,$08$.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_setclientcentric.htm)

methods.name: setCompatibilitySetting
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method sets !COMPAT values from STBL() functions. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_setcompatibilitysetting.htm)

methods.name: setOptionSetting
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method sets !OPTIONS values from STBL() functions. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_setoptionsetting.htm)

methods.name: suppressErrorsOnClientObjVoidMethods
methods.docu: In BBj 8.0 and higher, this method controls whether the Interpreter waits for completion of ClientObject methods that have void return type. If the Interpreter does not wait for completion then any exception that is generated on the client side during the method execution will not generate an error in the users program. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_suppresserrorsonclientobjvoidmethods.htm)

methods.name: suppressPrinterAckBack
methods.docu: Controls whether the Interpreter waits for a response from the printer before processing the next program statement.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_suppressprinterackback.htm)

methods.name: suppressUIAckBack
methods.docu: Controls whether the Interpreter waits for a response from UI before processing the next program statement.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_suppressuiackback.htm)

methods.name: unpinSession
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this BBjConfig method unpins all the programs and resources in a given session. Loading these programs or resources again causes BBj to check their timestamp and load a new version on disk, if the timestamp has changed. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_unpinsession.htm)

methods.name: unpinSessionEntity
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this BBjConfig method unpins the specified program or resource. Loading this program or resource again causes BBj to check its timestamp and load a new version on disk, if the timestamp has changed. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjconfig_unpinsessionentity.htm)

classes.name: BBjJettyServerConfiguration
classes.docu: In BBj 15.0 and higher this class is used to configure the integrated Jetty Server. It provides an interface to maintain contexts through the BBjJettyContextConfiguration class. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserverconfiguration/BBjJettyServerConfiguration.htm)

methods.name: createCustomContext
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method creates a new Context entry in the Jetty web server.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserverconfiguration/BBjJettyServerConfiguration_createCustomContext.htm)

methods.name: getCustomContext
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method gets a BBjJettyContextConfiguration for the name's context. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserverconfiguration/BBjJettyServerConfiguration_getCustomContext.htm)

methods.name: removeCustomContext
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method removes a Context Entry from the internal Jetty web server. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserverconfiguration/BBjJettyServerConfiguration_removeCustomContext.htm)

methods.name: getContextNames
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjVectorcontaining the names of the contexts configured in the Jetty web server. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserverconfiguration/BBjJettyServerConfiguration_getContextNames.htm)

methods.name: saveConfig
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method saves the configuration tobasis_home/cfg/jetty.xml, overwriting the existing file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserverconfiguration/BBjJettyServerConfiguration_saveConfig.htm)

methods.name: getRootContextInfo
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method gets a BBjJettyContextConfiguration for the default BBj context. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserverconfiguration/BBjJettyServerConfiguration_getRootContextInfo.htm)

methods.name: getEmContextInfo
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method gets a BBjJettyContextConfiguration for the Enterprise Manager context. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserverconfiguration/BBjJettyServerConfiguration_getEmContextInfo.htm)

methods.name: setAdminUser
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method sets the admin user stored in jetty.xml. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserverconfiguration/BBjJettyServerConfiguration_setAdminUser.htm)

methods.name: setAdminPassword
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method sets the admin password stored in jetty.xml. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserverconfiguration/BBjJettyServerConfiguration_setAdminPassword.htm)

classes.name: BBjJdbcOdbcInfo
classes.docu: In BBj 8.0 and higher, the BBjVector of BBjJdbcOdbcInfo objects provides programmatic access to information about all JDBC and ODBC connections within the current BBjServices environment. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjdbcodbcinfo/bbjjdbcodbcinfo.htm)

methods.name: close
methods.docu: In BBj 8.0 and higher, this method closes the JDBC/ODBC connection represented by this object. The client application will not receive any kind of notification regarding the closing of the connection so this may adversely effect the client application. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjdbcodbcinfo/bbjjdbcodbcinfo_close.htm)

methods.name: getConnectTime
methods.docu: In BBj 8.0 and higher, this method returns the date and time when one of the JDBC/ODBC connections opened in the BBjServices session. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjdbcodbcinfo/bbjjdbcodbcinfo_getconnecttime.htm)

methods.name: getDatabase
methods.docu: In BBj 8.0 and higher, this method returns the name of the database of one of the JDBC/ODBC connections currently open in the BBjServices session. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjdbcodbcinfo/bbjjdbcodbcinfo_getdatabase.htm)

methods.name: getHost
methods.docu: In BBj 8.0 and higher, this method returns the connected host name for one of the JDBC/ODBC connections currently open in the BBjServices session. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjdbcodbcinfo/bbjjdbcodbcinfo_gethost.htm)

methods.name: getID
methods.docu: In BBj 8.0 and higher, this method returns the unique connection identifier for one of the JDBC/ODBC connections currently open in the BBjServices session. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjdbcodbcinfo/bbjjdbcodbcinfo_getid.htm)

methods.name: getUser
methods.docu: In BBj 8.0 and higher, this method returns the name of the user who opened one of the JDBC/ODBC connections currently open in the BBjServices session. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjdbcodbcinfo/bbjjdbcodbcinfo_getuser.htm)

classes.name: BBjBusyIndicator
classes.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, the BBjBusyIndicator provides an interface to

                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBusyIndicator/BBjBusyIndicator.html)

methods.name: getHtml
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns the HTML that defines the overall appearance of the busy indicator. The $text$ placeholder indicates where the text from BBjBusyIndicator::setText(string) will be inserted. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBusyIndicator/BBjBusyIndicator_getHtml.html)

methods.name: getText
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns the text message set by

methods.name: isVisible
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether

methods.name: setHtml
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method sets the HTML that defines the overall appearance of the busy indicator. The $text$ placeholder indicates where the text from BBjBusyIndicator::setText(String) will be inserted. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBusyIndicator/BBjBusyIndicator_setHtml.html)

methods.name: setText
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method inserts the specified text message into the HTML string at the position indicated by the $text$ place-holder. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBusyIndicator/BBjBusyIndicator_setText.html)

methods.name: setVisible
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, if visible is true, this method places a translucent glass pane over the browser window and makes the busy indicator visible in the middle of the browser. If visible is false, this method removes the glass pane and busy indicator from the browser. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBusyIndicator/BBjBusyIndicator_setVisible.html)

methods.name: setAttribute
methods.docu: In BBj 22.02 and higher, this method sets a component attribute on the BBjBusyIndicator.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBusyIndicator/BBjBusyIndicator_setAttribute.htm)

methods.name: getAttribute
methods.docu: In BBj 22.02 and higher, this method returns a component attribute for the BBjBusyIndicator previously set with BBjBusyIndicator::setAttribute. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBusyIndicator/BBjBusyIndicator_getAttribute.htm)

classes.name: BBjNumber
classes.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, the BBjNumber object defines an object-oriented interface to traditional BBx numbers. It is not a java.lang.Number, but it implements the conversion methods defined by that class. This API is primarily designed to facilitate interaction with Java libraries. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjnumber/BBjNumber.htm)

methods.name: booleanValue
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the value of the specified

methods.name: byteValue
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the value of the specified

methods.name: equals
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method compares this BBjNumber with the specified Object for equality. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjnumber/BBjNumber_equals.htm)

methods.name: floatValue

methods.name: hashCode

methods.name: intValue

In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the value of the specified

methods.name: longValue
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the value of the specified

Only SQL and in-memory record sets are supported, which means that file record sets cannot be passed into the setRecordSet() call. See BBjAPI::createMemoryRecordSet for additional information about in-memory record sets. classes.name: BBjForm
classes.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, the BBjForm object allows users to build and print a document on the associated printer. The BBjForm API provides an object-oriented interface for building forms and reports for printing. It provides a good substitute for using SYSPRINT and PWINDOW for form building. SYSPRINT allows programmers to lay out a form, but requires everything to be explicit. It does not provide any abstraction. PWINDOW provides good abstraction, but the controls are focused more on the needs of a GUI rather than a printed form. The BBjForm API overcomes the shortcomings and limitations of both of these approaches by making available an object-oriented API specifically designed for laying out printed forms and reports. There is a clear path for using the BBjForm API. First, get the correct printer from BBjAPI and set the appropriate printer options on the resulting BBjPrinter object. Next, obtain a BBjForm object that represents a single printed form, allowing creation of one or more pages of the form. The programmer can lay out each page independently by creating BBjForm objects, setting their attributes, and adding them to the page. When the form is completed, use BBjForm methods to print, preview, or cancel the form. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjprint/bbjform/bbjform.htm)

classes.name: BBjNamespace
classes.docu:
In BBj 3.0 and higher, BBjNamespace provides a mechanism by which two or more BBj programs that are running in the same BBjServices can share data. It also provides methods that allow a program to be notified when that shared data is modified by some other program.

There are three types of BBjNamespaces, each with their own naming convention, level of visibility, and life cycle, with differences in scope and de-allocation of the shared memory.
  • Generic BBjNamespace - scope is global; memory is automatically freed when there are no longer any references.
  • Group BBjNamespace - scope is parent-children (group) interpreter (SCALLED or newBBjSession()) sessions; memory is automatically de-allocated when the group no longer exists
  • Global BBjNamespace - scope is global BBjServices or JVM wide; de-allocation only happens when items are removed from the namespace or restart of BBjServices (no automatic de-allocation)
[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjnamespace/bbjnamespace.htm)

methods.name: getName
methods.docu: In BBj 3.0 and higher, this method retrieves the name of the BBjNamespace. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjnamespace/bbjnamespace_getname.htm)

methods.name: removeValue

classes.name: BBjRecordSet
classes.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, a BBjRecordSet represents the set of records from a data file or SQL SELECT command. The BBjRecordSet maintains a pointer to the current record (BBjRecordData) with methods to insert, update, delete, and move between records. A record set is often bound to one or more data-aware GUI controls. See Interface RecordSetBindable::bindRecordSet for more information. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjrecordset/bbjrecordset.htm)

methods.name: close
