methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method specifies whether to use the WinConsole (debugger) instead of the SysConsole.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjcommandlineobject/bbjcommandlineobject_setwinconsole.htm)

methods.name: setWorkingDirectory
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method sets the working directory specified by the BBjCommandLineObject. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjcommandlineobject/bbjcommandlineobject_setworkingdirectory.htm)

methods.name: setMessage
methods.docu: In BBj 23 and higher, this method sets a default BBjSessionInfo message in the BBjCommandLineObject. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjcommandlineobject/BBjCommandLineObject_setMessage.htm)

methods.name: getMessage
methods.docu: In BBj 23 and higher, this method returns the default BBjSessionInfo message specified by the BBjCommandLineObject, or null() if none was specified. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconfig/bbjcommandlineobject/BBjCommandLineObject_getMessage.htm)

classes.name: BBjAdmin
classes.docu:
In BBj 5.0 and higher, the BBjAdmin object provides programmatic 
 access to the global BBjServices configuration. This may affect other 
 BBj clients.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/bbjadmin.htm)

methods.name: addUser
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method adds a user. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/bbjadmin_adduser.htm)

methods.name: changePassword
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method changes the password for a given user. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/bbjadmin_changepassword.htm)

methods.name: getDatabaseGlobal
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method gets the specified database property value.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/bbjadmin_getdatabaseglobal.htm)

methods.name: getEnvironment
methods.docu: In BBj 5.0 and higher, this method retrieves the BBjAdminEnvironment object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/bbjadmin_getenvironment.htm)

methods.name: getJdbcOdbcConnections
methods.docu: In BBj 8.0 and higher, this method retrieves a BBjVector of BBjJdbcOdbcInfo objects; one for each JDBC or ODBC connection that is currently open. This does NOT include open SQL channels or RecordSet objects unless they are open from a remote interpreter. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/bbjadmin_getjdbcodbcconnections.htm)

methods.name: getOpenFileInfos
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method retrieves a BBjVector of BBjOpenFileInfo object; one for each file that is currently open. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/bbjadmin_getopenfileinfos.htm)

methods.name: getPermission
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns an indication of whether a user has a permission. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/bbjadmin_getpermission.htm)

methods.name: getQueryAnalysisInfo
methods.docu:
This 
            method is used strictly by BASIS admin tools.  This information is 
            available in a human readable user interface in the Enterprise Manager 
            on the Query Analysis tab of the table editors.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/BBjAdmin_getQueryAnalysisInfo.htm)

methods.name: getServletRegistry
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and a BBjServletRegistry object which is used to publish and unpublish servlets to the web server. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/BBjAdmin_getServletRegistry.htm)

methods.name: getWebAppServer
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the BBjAppServer, which is used to publish and administer BUI applications. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/BBjAdmin_getWebAppServer.htm)

methods.name: release
methods.docu: Cleans up and releases the resources used by the BBjAdmin instance. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/BBjAdmin_release.htm)

methods.name: reloadDBConfig
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method reloads the config.ini file without requiring a restart of BBjServices. The config.ini file contains database configuration information for all databases available to BBjServices.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/bbjadmin_reloaddbconfig.htm)

methods.name: removeDatabaseGlobal
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method removes the specified database property.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/BBjAdmin_removeDatabaseGlobal.htm)

methods.name: removeUser
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method removes a user from the system. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/bbjadmin_removeuser.htm)

methods.name: setDatabaseGlobal
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method sets the specified database property to the specified value.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/bbjadmin_setdatabaseglobal.htm)

methods.name: setPermission
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method sets a permission for a user. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/bbjadmin_setpermission.htm)

methods.name: getJettyServer
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method gets the BBjJettyServer to allow programmatic control of the integrated Jetty Server. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/BBjAdmin_getJettyServer.htm)

methods.name: getJettyServerConfig
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method enables the BBjJettyServerConfiguration to allow programmatic configuration of the integrated Jetty Server. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadmin/BBjAdmin_getJettyServerConfig.htm)

classes.name: BBjTriggerData
classes.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, BBjTriggerData provides access to the running trigger. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata.htm)

methods.name: getAllowOverwrite
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, if no key was specified in a Write Trigger, this method indicates whether write will overwrite or throw an error. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getallowoverwrite.htm)

methods.name: getDirection
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method the DIR option's value. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getdirection.htm)

methods.name: getDOM
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method indicates whether the VERB resulting in this Trigger had a DOM= branch. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getdom.htm)

methods.name: getExpectedDiskData
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher and in an Update Trigger, this method returns the expected record value currently on disk before the update occurs. The expected disk data must match the actual data on disk or an error is generated when the file system attempts to update the record on disk. This value is empty for Triggers fired by a WRITE RECORD call in the language. The value is only relevant during SQL UPDATE statements and calls to the update() methods on JLIB FilePosition instances. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getexpecteddiskdata.htm)

methods.name: getExtract
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method indicates whether the read operation occurred as a result of an EXTRACT call. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getextract.htm)

methods.name: getField
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns whether the FileSystem should perform Field Terminated reads when reading a string file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getfield.htm)

methods.name: getFind
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method indicates whether this read Trigger is a result of a FIND Verb. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getfind.htm)

methods.name: getIDString
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns the ID String to be associated with the opened file in Enterprise Manager. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getidstring.htm)

methods.name: getIndex
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns the IND option's value. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getindex.htm)

methods.name: getKey
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, this method returns the Key option's value. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getkey.htm)

methods.name: getKeyCallType
methods.docu:
In BBj 11.0 and higher, this method returns the type of KEY call that 
 was used to fire the KEY trigger. This method is only valid from inside 
 KEY triggers.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getkeycalltype.htm)

methods.name: getKeyDescriptions
methods.docu:
In BBj 9.00 and higher, this method returns the key description string 
 describing the keys defined on the data file (if it is a multi-keyed MKEYED, 
 XKEYED, or VKEYED file).[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getkeydescriptions.htm)

methods.name: getKeyName
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns the KNUM option's value if it is a string. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getkeyname.htm)

methods.name: getKeyNumber
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns the KNUM option's value if it is numeric. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getkeynumber.htm)

methods.name: getReadBuffer
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, and in an After-Read Trigger, this method returns the byte string read by the Filesystem. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getreadbuffer.htm)

methods.name: getSize
methods.docu: In BBj 11.0 and higher, this method returns the SIZ option's value.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getsize.htm)

methods.name: getTimeout
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, this method returns the TIM option's value. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_gettimeout.htm)

methods.name: getTriggerType
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns the type of trigger currently being executed. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_gettriggertype.htm)

methods.name: getUser
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns the name of the user who is accessing the file to which the Trigger is attached. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getuser.htm)

methods.name: getWriteBuffer
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, this method returns the record passed into a call to WRITE RECORD in a BBj program or the record being written to the data file in an SQL INSERT or UPDATE statement. This is the raw data written to disk so a string template should typically be used to parse the record into usable fields if processing of the information is required. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getwritebuffer.htm)

methods.name: setEOF
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method causes the Read/Extract Verb to throw an EOF error. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_seteof.htm)

methods.name: setExpectedDiskData
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, and in an Update Trigger, this method sets the expected record value currently on disk before the update occurs. The expected disk data must match the actual data on disk or an error is generated when the file system attempts to update the record on disk. This value is ignored for Triggers fired by a WRITE RECORD call in the language. The value is only relevant during SQL UPDATE statements and calls to the update() methods on JLIB FilePosition instances. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_setexpecteddiskdata.htm)

methods.name: setReadBuffer
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, and in Read Trigger, this method sets the buffer which will be returned to the Read/Extract Verb. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_setreadbuffer.htm)

methods.name: setWriteBuffer
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, this method set the write buffer to be written to the disk. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_setwritebuffer.htm)

methods.name: getBBjProgram
methods.docu: In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method gets the name of the BBj program that opened the file via OPEN or SQLOPEN from a BBjTriggerData object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/BBjTriggerData_getBBjProgram.htm)

methods.name: getFilename
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns the filename of the file to which this Trigger is attached. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getfilename.htm)

methods.name: getModeValue
methods.docu:
In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method returns the value for the specified 
 key defined in the MODE string when the file was opened.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/BBjTriggerData/bbjtriggerdata_getmodevalue.htm)

classes.name: BBjAPI
classes.docu: The BBjAPI object is the entry point for creating and using BBj Objects.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi.htm)

methods.name: asBytes
methods.docu:
This method returns a byte[] object, typically to pass into a Java method 
 that expects a byte[] array.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_asbytes.htm)

methods.name: changePassword
methods.docu: In BBj 7.00 and higher, this method changes the password for a given user.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_changepassword.htm)

methods.name: clearCustomEventCallback
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, this method clears a callback that has been set for a specified BBjCustomEvent. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_clearcustomeventcallback.htm)

methods.name: cloneAsClientObject
methods.docu: In BBj 8.00 and higher, this method creates a clone of a server-side object on the client and returns a ClientObject that is an RMI handle to that client-side Object.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_cloneasclientobject.htm)

methods.name: cloneAsServerObject
methods.docu: In BBj 8.00 and higher, this method creates a clone of a client-side object on the server.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_cloneasserverobject.htm)

methods.name: createFileRecordSet
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method creates a BBjRecordSet bound to a multikeyed MKEYED or XKEYED file. In BBj 6.00 and higher, a BBjRecordSet can also be bound to a multikeyed VKEYED file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_createfilerecordset.htm)

methods.name: createMemoryRecordSet
methods.docu: In BBj 7.00 and higher, this method creates a record set in memory that behaves in the same way as an SQL record set. A memory record set allows the developer to create a record set from a string template and then populate that template with data as they see fit.  One of the most common uses for memory record sets is in stored procedures because stored procedures often need to return an SQL result set to the client application. A memory record set gives the developer the ability to create a record set (that the SQL engine later converts to a result set), populate this record set with arbitrary data, and return the record set as the result of the stored procedure call. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_creatememoryrecordset.htm)

methods.name: createSQLRecordSet
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method creates a BBjRecordSet bound to an SQL SELECT statement. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_createSQLRecordSet.htm)

methods.name: createSQLRecordSet
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method creates a BBjRecordSet bound to an SQL SELECT statement. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_createSQLRecordSet.htm)

methods.name: createSQLRecordSet
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method creates a BBjRecordSet bound to an SQL SELECT statement. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_createSQLRecordSet.htm)

methods.name: createTimer
methods.docu: In BBj 3.00 and higher, this method creates a timer, which calls a method on a UserObject at a specified interval.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_createtimer.htm)

methods.name: createTimer
methods.docu: In BBj 3.00 and higher, this method creates a timer, which calls a method on a UserObject at a specified interval.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_createtimer.htm)

methods.name: getAdmin
methods.docu: In BBj 5.00 and higher, this method retrieves the current BBjAdmin object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getadmin.htm)

methods.name: getAdmin
methods.docu: In BBj 5.00 and higher, this method retrieves the current BBjAdmin object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getadmin.htm)

methods.name: getAppletProxy
methods.docu: In BBj 2.02 and higher, this method returns a BBjAppletProxy.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getappletproxy.htm)

methods.name: getBBjEnterpriseNamespace
methods.docu: In BBj 13.00 and higher, this method returns a reference to a BBjEnterpriseNamespace. An enterprise namespace is used to share information between separate BBjServices processes. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getbbjenterprisenamespace.htm)

methods.name: getBBjEnterpriseNamespace
methods.docu: In BBj 13.00 and higher, this method returns a reference to a BBjEnterpriseNamespace. An enterprise namespace is used to share information between separate BBjServices processes. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getbbjenterprisenamespace.htm)

methods.name: getBBjEnterpriseNamespace
methods.docu: In BBj 13.00 and higher, this method returns a reference to a BBjEnterpriseNamespace. An enterprise namespace is used to share information between separate BBjServices processes. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getbbjenterprisenamespace.htm)

methods.name: getBBjEnterpriseNamespace
methods.docu: In BBj 13.00 and higher, this method returns a reference to a BBjEnterpriseNamespace. An enterprise namespace is used to share information between separate BBjServices processes. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getbbjenterprisenamespace.htm)

methods.name: getBBjPDFForm
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, this method automatically obtains a BBjPrinter object and returns a BBjForm object that allows printing a document to a PDF file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getbbjpdfform.htm)

methods.name: getBBjPDFForm
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, this method automatically obtains a BBjPrinter object and returns a BBjForm object that allows printing a document to a PDF file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getbbjpdfform.htm)

methods.name: getBBjPDFForm
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, this method automatically obtains a BBjPrinter object and returns a BBjForm object that allows printing a document to a PDF file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getbbjpdfform.htm)

methods.name: getBBjPDFForm
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, this method automatically obtains a BBjPrinter object and returns a BBjForm object that allows printing a document to a PDF file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getbbjpdfform.htm)

methods.name: getBBjPrinter
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method obtains a BBjPrinter object that allows printing documents.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getbbjprinter.htm)

methods.name: getBBjPrinter
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method obtains a BBjPrinter object that allows printing documents.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getbbjprinter.htm)

methods.name: getBBjPrinter
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method obtains a BBjPrinter object that allows printing documents.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getbbjprinter.htm)

methods.name: getBuiManager
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, the BBjBuiManager object provides an interface to BUI and DWC application runtime settings. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getBuiManager.htm)

methods.name: getWebManager
methods.docu: In BBj 22.03 and higher, the BBjWebManager object provides an interface to BUI and DWC application runtime settings. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getWebManager.htm)

methods.name: getClientProperty
methods.docu: In BBj 7.00 and higher, this method returns a java.lang.Object that is currently stored in the interpreter's client properties.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getclientproperty.htm)

methods.name: getConfig
methods.docu: Retrieves the current BBjConfig.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getconfig.htm)

methods.name: getConstants
methods.docu: In BBj 11.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjConstants object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getconstants.htm)

methods.name: getCurrentSessionInfo
getDefaultPrinterName
methods.docu:
In BBj 13.00 and higher, this method returns the name of the default 
 printer.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getdefaultprintername.htm)

methods.name: getExistingNamespace
methods.docu: In BBj 3.00 and higher, this method retrieves a BBjNamespace. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getexistingnamespace.htm)

methods.name: getExistingNamespaceNames
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of existing BBjNamespace names (omitting the global namespace). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getExistingNamespaceNames.htm)

methods.name: removeNamespace
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method removes a BBjNamespace. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_removeNamespace.htm)

methods.name: getFileSystem
methods.docu: Obtains a BBjFileSystem object that allows interaction with the BBj filesystem. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getfilesystem.htm)

methods.name: getEventData
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjEventData object when used exclusively inside an administrative event handler program. The administration server (part of BBjServices) calls this special type of event handler program when the administrator configures an event handler using the Enterprise Manager or Admin API. Outside an event handler program, this method returns null.
[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getEventData.htm)

methods.name: getGlobalNamespace
methods.docu: In BBj 3.00 and higher, this method retrieves a BBjNamespace. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getglobalnamespace.htm)

methods.name: getGroupNamespace
methods.docu: In BBj 3.00 and higher, this method retrieves a BBjNamespace. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getgroupnamespace.htm)

methods.name: getInterpreterServer
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjInterpreterServer. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getinterpreterserver.htm)

methods.name: getJDBCConnection
methods.docu: In BBj 9.00 and higher, this method returns a java.sql.Connection, implemented as a BBjCollapsableJDBCConnection, to the specified JDBC connection URL or BBj database. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getjdbcconnection.htm)

methods.name: getJDBCConnection
methods.docu: In BBj 9.00 and higher, this method returns a java.sql.Connection, implemented as a BBjCollapsableJDBCConnection, to the specified JDBC connection URL or BBj database. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getjdbcconnection.htm)

methods.name: getJDBCConnection
methods.docu: In BBj 9.00 and higher, this method returns a java.sql.Connection, implemented as a BBjCollapsableJDBCConnection, to the specified JDBC connection URL or BBj database. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getjdbcconnection.htm)

methods.name: getJDBCConnection
methods.docu: In BBj 9.00 and higher, this method returns a java.sql.Connection, implemented as a BBjCollapsableJDBCConnection, to the specified JDBC connection URL or BBj database. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getjdbcconnection.htm)

methods.name: getLastBBjException
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns a java.lang.Throwable object that corresponds to the last exception reported from a BBj error. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getLastBBjException.htm)

methods.name: clearLastBBjException
methods.docu: In BBj 16.00 and higher, this method clears the value returned by BBjAPI::getLastBBjException. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_clearLastBBjException.htm)

methods.name: getLastEvent
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, this method returns the most recent event generated in the current BBj session.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getlastevent.htm)

methods.name: getLastException
methods.docu: This method returns a java.lang.Throwable object that corresponds to the last exception reported from a failed Java call. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getlastexception.htm)

methods.name: getLastJavaException
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns a java.lang.Throwable object that corresponds to the last exception reported from a failed Java call. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getLastJavaException.htm)

methods.name: clearLastJavaException
methods.docu: In BBj 16.00 and higher, this method clears the value returned by BBjAPI::getLastJavaException. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_clearLastJavaException.htm)

methods.name: getLDAPConnection
methods.docu: In BBj 11.00 and higher, this method returns a connection to an LDAP or Active Directory server. Use this method to connect to a specific LDAP server by specifying host, port, bind DN, and password. The method taking no parameters returns a connection to the LDAP server used for authentication.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getldapconnection.htm)

methods.name: getLDAPConnection
methods.docu: In BBj 11.00 and higher, this method returns a connection to an LDAP or Active Directory server. Use this method to connect to a specific LDAP server by specifying host, port, bind DN, and password. The method taking no parameters returns a connection to the LDAP server used for authentication.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getldapconnection.htm)

methods.name: getMDI
methods.docu:
In BBj 3.0 and higher this method returns a BBjMDI object that represents 
 a SYSGUI window.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getmdi.htm)

methods.name: getNamespace
methods.docu: In BBj 3.00 and higher, this method retrieves a BBjNamespace. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getnamespace.htm)

methods.name: getNewNamespace
methods.docu: In BBj 3.00 and higher, this method creates a new BBjNamespace. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getnewnamespace.htm)

methods.name: getObjectTable
methods.docu: Obtains a BBjObjectTable that allows access to a map of key value pairs that is accessible at all program levels.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getobjecttable.htm)

methods.name: getProgramInfo
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjProgramInfo object that provides programmatic access to information about a program. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getprograminfo.htm)

methods.name: getServletData
methods.docu: Creates a BBjServletData object that allows registered servlets to receive callback events from the web server. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getServletData.htm)

methods.name: getSessionInfos
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of BBjSessionInfo Objects. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getsessioninfos.htm)

methods.name: getSysGui
methods.docu: Obtains a BBjSysGui object that represents a SysGui channel and is used to facilitate the creation and manipulation of custom graphical windows and controls in a GUI application.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getsysgui.htm)

methods.name: getOpenChannels
methods.docu: In BBj 18.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of open channel numbers. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getOpenChannels.htm)

methods.name: getOpenSQLChannels
methods.docu: In BBj 18.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of open SQL channel numbers. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getOpenSQLChannels.htm)

methods.name: getThinClient
methods.docu:
Obtains a BBjThinClient that provides a method to execute on the client's 
 machine in a thin client environment.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_getthinclient.htm)

methods.name: isInMDI
methods.docu: In BBj 3.00 and higher, this method returns an indication of whether the current program is being run within an MDI host.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_isinmdi.htm)

methods.name: killSession
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method kills a running BBj session.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_killsession.htm)

methods.name: listProcessStatus
methods.docu: This method provides a list of BBj processes that are running in BBjServices.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_listprocessstatus.htm)

methods.name: listProcessStatus
methods.docu: This method provides a list of BBj processes that are running in BBjServices.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_listprocessstatus.htm)

methods.name: lookupPrinters
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method looks up a list of printer names that satisfy a given set of javax.print.attribute.PrintService attributes. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_lookupprinters.htm)

methods.name: makeColor
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method creates a BBjColor object from the specified parameters. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_makecolor.htm)

methods.name: makeColor
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method creates a BBjColor object from the specified parameters. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_makecolor.htm)

methods.name: makeColor
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method creates a BBjColor object from the specified parameters. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_makecolor.htm)

methods.name: makeColor
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method creates a BBjColor object from the specified parameters. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_makecolor.htm)

methods.name: makeTemplatedString
methods.docu: In BBj 7.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjTemplatedString with a specified template. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_maketemplatedstring.htm)

methods.name: makeVector
methods.docu:
Creates a BBjVector object, which is a single dimensional array that 
 maintains a list of objects and sizes to fit dynamically the number of 
 objects added.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_makevector.htm)

methods.name: copy
methods.docu: In BBj 16.00 and higher, this method copies elements from a BBjVector to a BBj array. In BBj 20.30 and higher, this method can also copy from one BBj array to another. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_copy.htm)

methods.name: copy
methods.docu: In BBj 16.00 and higher, this method copies elements from a BBjVector to a BBj array. In BBj 20.30 and higher, this method can also copy from one BBj array to another. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_copy.htm)

methods.name: newBBjSession
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method starts a new BBj session.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_newbbjsession.htm)

methods.name: newSynchBBjSession
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method starts a new BBj session and waits for it to complete.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_newsynchbbjsession.htm)

methods.name: openSysGui
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method obtains a BBjSysGui object that represents a SysGui channel and is used to facilitate the creation and manipulation of custom graphical windows and controls in a GUI application. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_opensysgui.htm)

methods.name: postCustomEvent
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, this method posts a BBjCustomEvent at the end of the BBj event queue. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_postcustomevent.htm)

methods.name: postPriorityCustomEvent
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, this method posts a BBjCustomEvent at the beginning of the BBj event queue. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_postprioritycustomevent.htm)

methods.name: removeAllTimers
methods.docu: In BBj 3.0 and higher, this method removes all timers previously created by the BBj process that is making this call.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_removealltimers.htm)

methods.name: removeTimer
methods.docu: In BBj 3.00 and higher, this method removes a timer previously created with BBjAPI::createTimer.  [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_removetimer.htm)

methods.name: setClientProperty
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method sets a property's value in the interpreter to the specified java.lang.Object.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_setclientproperty.htm)

methods.name: setCustomEventCallback
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, this method sets a callback that is to be called when the specified BBjCustomEvent appears on the BBj event queue. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_setcustomeventcallback.htm)

methods.name: setCustomEventCallback
methods.docu: In BBj 6.00 and higher, this method sets a callback that is to be called when the specified BBjCustomEvent appears on the BBj event queue. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/bbjapi_setcustomeventcallback.htm)

methods.name: setStbl
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method manipulates the global string table.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_setStbl.htm)

methods.name: getStbl
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns the value of a specified 
 global string in the global string table.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getStbl.htm)

methods.name: getErrorInfo
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, the BBjErrorInfo object encapsulates assorted error information from a specific instant in time, typically captured in an error handler. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getErrorInfo.htm)

methods.name: getErrorInfo
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, the BBjErrorInfo object encapsulates assorted error information from a specific instant in time, typically captured in an error handler. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getErrorInfo.htm)

methods.name: registerMetricCounter
methods.docu: In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method registers and returns a new metrics Counter object.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_registerMetricCounter.htm)

methods.name: getMetricCounter
methods.docu: In BBj 18.00 and higher, this method returns a metrics Counter object with a given name.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getMetricCounter.htm)

methods.name: unregisterMetricCounter
methods.docu: In BBj 18.00 and higher, BBj supports metrics. The metrics are exported in a format compatible with the Prometheus time series database. See BBj Metrics documentation for more information. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_unregisterMetricCounter.htm)

methods.name: registerMetricGauge
methods.docu: In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method registers and returns a new metrics Gauge object.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_registerMetricGauge.htm)

methods.name: getMetricGauge
methods.docu: In BBj 18.00 and higher, this method returns a metrics Gauge with the given name.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getMetricGauge.htm)

methods.name: unregisterMetricGauge
methods.docu: In BBj 18.00 and higher, this method unregisters a metric Gauge object with the given name.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_unregisterMetricGauge.htm)

methods.name: getFunctionDebugCounts
methods.docu: This method is used by the BBj Function Debugging subsystem. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getFunctionDebugCounts.htm)

methods.name: getFunctionDebugNanoTimes
methods.docu: This method is used by the BBj Function Debugging subsystem. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_getFunctionDebugNanoTimes.htm)

methods.name: resetFunctionDebug
methods.docu: This method is used by the BBj Function Debugging subsystem. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_resetFunctionDebug.htm)

methods.name: isSAMAvailable
methods.docu: In BBj 24.11 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether the SAM license feature is available. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_isSAMAvailable.htm)

methods.name: lcheckout
methods.docu: In 24.11 and higher, this method checks out one license for the specified feature.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_lcheckout.htm)

methods.name: lcheckin
methods.docu: In BBj 24.11 and higher, this method checks in a license that was previously checked out with lcheckout(). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjapi/BBjAPI_lcheckin.htm)

classes.name: BBjBuiMsgCloseAction
classes.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, the BBjBuiMsgCloseAction object provides an interface to display a message on termination of a BUI or DWC application.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiMsgCloseAction/BBjBuiMsgCloseAction.htm)

methods.name: getActionType
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns an integer constant identifying the type of this close action (ACTION_MSG). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiMsgCloseAction/BBjBuiMsgCloseAction_getActionType.htm)

methods.name: getActionTypeString
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns a string constant identifying the type of this close action (ACTION_MSG). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiMsgCloseAction/BBjBuiMsgCloseAction_getActionTypeString.htm)

methods.name: getMessage
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns the text message from this close action.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiMsgCloseAction/bbjbuimsgcloseAction_getmessage.htm)

classes.name: BBjKeySegment
classes.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, BBjKeySegment objects are used to construct BBjKeyInfo objects. BBjKeyInfo objects can be used to manipulate VKEYED file key chains dynamically. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjkeysegment/bbjkeysegment.htm)

methods.name: getField
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns the field number of a BBjKeySegment object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjkeysegment/bbjkeysegment_getfield.htm)

methods.name: getOffset
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns the zero-based offset of a BBjKeySegment object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjkeysegment/bbjkeysegment_getoffset.htm)

methods.name: getLength
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns the length of a BBjKeySegment object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjkeysegment/bbjkeysegment_getlength.htm)

methods.name: isDescending
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns whether a BBjKeySegment object is sorted in descending sequence. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjkeysegment/bbjkeysegment_isdescending.htm)

methods.name: isNumeric
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns whether a BBjKeySegment object contains a Business Math value. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjkeysegment/bbjkeysegment_isnumeric.htm)

methods.name: isBUS
methods.docu: In BBj 10.0 and higher, this method returns whether a BBjKeySegment object contains a Business Math value [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjkeysegment/bbjkeysegment_isbus.htm)

methods.name: isOrderedNumeric
methods.docu: In BBj 10.0 and higher, this method returns whether a BBjKeySegment object contains an ordered numeric value [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjkeysegment/bbjkeysegment_isorderednumeric.htm)

classes.name: BBjRecoverFileStatus
classes.docu: In BBj 18.00 and higher, the BBjRecoverFileStatus object is used to return various status information from file recovery. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjrecoverfilestatus/BBjRecoverFileStatus.htm)

methods.name: getRecoverStartTimeMillis
methods.docu:
In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method returns 
            the file recovery start time in milliseconds.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjrecoverfilestatus/BBjRecoverFileStatus_getRecoverStartTimeMillis.htm)

methods.name: getRecoverFinishTimeMillis
methods.docu:
In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method returns 
            the file recovery finish time in milliseconds.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjrecoverfilestatus/BBjRecoverFileStatus_getRecoverFinishTimeMillis.htm)

methods.name: getOriginalFileType
methods.docu:
In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method returns 
            the file recovery type.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjrecoverfilestatus/BBjRecoverFileStatus_getOriginalFileType.htm)

methods.name: getOriginalFilename
methods.docu:
In BBj 18.0 and higher, this 
 method returns the file recovery filename. This is now the recovered file. 
 The original file has been backed up.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjrecoverfilestatus/BBjRecoverFileStatus_getOriginalFilename.htm)

methods.name: getRecoverBackupFilename
methods.docu: In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method returns the file recovery file name for the recovered file backup. This is the original file that was recovered, the recovered file is now using the original file name. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjrecoverfilestatus/BBjRecoverFileStatus_getRecoverBackupFilename.htm)

methods.name: getOriginalRecordSize
methods.docu:
In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method returns the file recovery record 
 size from the original file. This is also the record size in the recovered 
 file.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjrecoverfilestatus/BBjRecoverFileStatus_getOriginalRecordSize.htm)

methods.name: getOriginalRecordCount
methods.docu:
In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method returns the file recovery original 
 record count.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjrecoverfilestatus/BBjRecoverFileStatus_getOriginalRecordCount.htm)

methods.name: getRecoveredRecordCount
methods.docu:
In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method returns the file recovery recovered 
 record count.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjrecoverfilestatus/BBjRecoverFileStatus_getRecoveredRecordCount.htm)

methods.name: getRecordsFound
methods.docu:
In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method returns the file recovery number 
 of records found in the original file.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjrecoverfilestatus/BBjRecoverFileStatus_getRecordsFound.htm)

methods.name: getOriginalSize
methods.docu:
In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method returns the file recovery original 
 file size.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjrecoverfilestatus/BBjRecoverFileStatus_getOriginalSize.htm)

methods.name: getRecoveredSize
methods.docu:
In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method returns the file recovery recovered 
 file size.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjrecoverfilestatus/BBjRecoverFileStatus_getRecoveredSize.htm)

classes.name: BBjClientFileSystem
classes.docu:
The BBjClientFileSystem object provides developers access to files on 
 the computer providing the display to the user.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfilesystem/bbjclientfilesystem.htm)

methods.name: getClientFile
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjClientFile that represents a specific file on the remote computer. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfilesystem/bbjclientfilesystem_getclientfile.htm)

methods.name: getClientFile
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjClientFile that represents a specific file on the remote computer. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfilesystem/bbjclientfilesystem_getclientfile.htm)

methods.name: getHomeDirectory
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjClientFile that represents the home directory of the user running BBj on the client computer. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfilesystem/bbjclientfilesystem_gethomedirectory.htm)

methods.name: getRoots
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of BBjClientFile objects that represent the filesystem roots on the client computer.  [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfilesystem/bbjclientfilesystem_getroots.htm)

classes.name: BBjAppletProxy
classes.docu: The BBjAppletProxy provides control of the Applet and AppletContext when a BBj program is being run through an Applet.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjappletproxy/bbjappletproxy.htm)

methods.name: setBounds
methods.docu: In BBj 2.02 and higher, this method sets the location and size of a running Applet.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjappletproxy/bbjappletproxy_setbounds.htm)

methods.name: getParam
methods.docu: In BBj 2.02 and higher, this method retrieves the value of a parameter that was set within the HTML from which the Applet was launched.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjappletproxy/bbjappletproxy_getparam.htm)

methods.name: showDocument
methods.docu: In BBj 2.02 and higher, this method displays the specified URL in a separate browser frame.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjappletproxy/bbjappletproxy_showdocument.htm)

methods.name: showStatus
methods.docu: In BBj 2.02 and higher, this method displays a message on the browser status bar.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjappletproxy/bbjappletproxy_showstatus.htm)

methods.name: playAudio
methods.docu: In BBj 2.02 and higher, this method displays a specified URL in a separate browser frame.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjappletproxy/bbjappletproxy_playaudio.htm)

methods.name: playAudio
methods.docu: In BBj 2.02 and higher, this method displays a specified URL in a separate browser frame.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjappletproxy/bbjappletproxy_playaudio.htm)

methods.name: addFrame
methods.docu: In BBj 2.02 and higher, this method displays a specified URL in a frame within the Applet.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjappletproxy/bbjappletproxy_addframe.htm)

methods.name: removeFrame
methods.docu: In BBj 2.02 and higher, this method removes a frame that has previously been created through a call to addFrame(). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjappletproxy/bbjappletproxy_removeframe.htm)

classes.name: BBjProgramInfo
classes.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, the BBjProgramInfo object provides programmatic access to information about a program. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjprograminfo/bbjprograminfo.htm)

methods.name: getListingForLine
methods.docu: In BBj 22.11 and higher, this method returns the listing for a specified user-defined or physical line of a program referenced by a BBjProgramInfo object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjprograminfo/BBjProgramInfo_getListingForLine.htm)

classes.name: BBjPrintPreviewBuilder
classes.docu: In BBj 13.0 and higher, the BBjPrintPreviewBuilder object provides methods for configuring print preview, for example setting the initial view to two pages.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjprint/bbjprintpreviewbuilder/BBjPrintPreviewBuilder.html)

methods.name: closeOnPrint
methods.docu: In BBj 13.0 and higher, this method overrides the default and keeps preview open. The print preview default is to exit after printing.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjprint/bbjprintpreviewbuilder/BBjPrintPreviewBuilder_closeOnPrint.html)

methods.name: editPassword
methods.docu: In BBj 13.0 and higher, this method sets the editor password, allowing modification of any document saved as a PDF.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjprint/bbjprintpreviewbuilder/BBjPrintPreviewBuilder_editPassword.html)

methods.name: maximize
methods.docu: In BBj 13.0 and higher, this method maximizes the Print Preview window after opening.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjprint/bbjprintpreviewbuilder/BBjPrintPreviewBuilder_maximize.html)

methods.name: openPassword
methods.docu: In BBj 13.0 and higher, this method sets the open password that required to open any document saved as a PDF.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjprint/bbjprintpreviewbuilder/BBjPrintPreviewBuilder_openPassword.html)

methods.name: preview
methods.docu: In BBj 13.0 and higher, this method opens a preview window once configuration is complete.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjprint/bbjprintpreviewbuilder/BBjPrintPreviewBuilder_preview.html)

methods.name: secure
methods.docu: In BBj 13.0 and higher, this method sets secure(0) to override the default, removing all document security. This is useful after saving a PDF as the file is not editable by default.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjprint/bbjprintpreviewbuilder/BBjPrintPreviewBuilder_secure.html)

methods.name: style
methods.docu: In BBj 13.0 and higher, this method controls the view style. "HEIGHT" fits a page vertically in the available space, "WIDTH" horizontally in the available space, "TWO" displays two pages side-by-side.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjprint/bbjprintpreviewbuilder/BBjPrintPreviewBuilder_style.html)

methods.name: zoom
methods.docu: In BBj 13.00 and higher, this method scales the document to take up more or less space in the preview window; zoom 50 is half size, zoom 200 is double size.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjprint/bbjprintpreviewbuilder/bbjprintpreviewbuilder_zoom.html)

classes.name: BBjApplication
classes.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, the BBjApplication object represents a published BUI application and is immutable. Changes are made through the BBjAppConfig object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/bbjapplication.htm)

methods.name: getApplicationIcon
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjResourceUrl corresponding to the application's icon. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getApplicationIcon.html)

methods.name: getApplicationUserName
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the application user name, which corresponds to the BBj -n parameter. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getApplicationUserName.html)

methods.name: getBBjApplicationName
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the application name, which corresponds to the BBj -a parameter.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getBBjApplicationName.html)

methods.name: getClasspathName
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the session classpath for this application.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getClasspathName.html)

methods.name: getClientPollInterval
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this is the number of seconds the web server will wait for the next command from the server. The default value is 50 seconds. If the web server does not receive a command from BBjServices in the configured time period, it will send a heartbeat to the browser.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getClientPollInterval.html)

methods.name: getConfigFile
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this is the name of the config.bbx file to use for this application.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getConfigFile.html)

methods.name: getDevelopmentMode
methods.docu: In BBj 16.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether this BUI app should be run in development mode. The default value is false. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getDevelopmentMode.htm)

methods.name: getDisallowConsole
methods.docu:
In BBj 19.10 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether 
 console access is disallowed.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getDisallowConsole.htm)

methods.name: getEndAction
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns the action that will occur on normal application termination.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getEndAction.html)

methods.name: getErrAction
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns the action that will occur on abnormal application termination.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getErrAction.html)

methods.name: getInterpreterUser
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the interpreter user name, which corresponds to the BBj -u command line parameter.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getInterpreterUser.html)

methods.name: getLoadImage
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjResourceUrl representing the application's load image (splash screen). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getLoadImage.html)

methods.name: getManageBrowserHistory
methods.docu: In BBj 16.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether this BUI will manage this app's browser history. The default value is false. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getManageBrowserHistory.htm)

methods.name: getName
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the name of the application as it will be published.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getName.html)

methods.name: getOmitBasisCss
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether this BUI app 
should be run without the default BASIS CSS. The default value is false.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getOmitBasisCss.htm)

methods.name: getProgramArguments
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of user-defined program arguments. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getProgramArguments.html)

methods.name: getProgramName
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the BBj program name.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getProgramName.html)

methods.name: getSecure
methods.docu:
In BBj 19.10 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether 
 secure mode was specified for this BBjApplication. The default value is 
 false.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getSecure.htm)

methods.name: getSessionTimeout
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the length of time in seconds a non-responsive BUI session will be considered active. If the session expires without response, the web-tier will send a NET_DROPPED error back to the server. The default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes). -1 corresponds to no timeout. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getSessionTimeout.html)

methods.name: getShowBrowserWarning
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns whether to display a browser 
 warning the first time the user attempts to run a BUI application in Internet 
 Explorer 8. The default value is true.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getShowBrowserWarning.html)

methods.name: getShowClientConfirmationDialog
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns whether to display a confirmation dialog when the user attempts to leave the application's page. The default value is true.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getShowClientConfirmationDialog.html)

methods.name: getStyleSheet
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjResourceUrl representing the application's style sheet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getStyleSheet.html)

methods.name: getTerminal
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the application's terminal alias.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getTerminal.html)

methods.name: getWorkingDirectory
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the application's working directory.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_getWorkingDirectory.html)

methods.name: isBuiEnabled
methods.docu: In BBj 21.10 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether this application is enabled in the BUI client.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_isBuiEnabled.htm)

methods.name: isDwcEnabled
methods.docu: In BBj 21.10 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether this application is enabled in the DWC client.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_isDwcEnabled.html)

methods.name: isDesktopEnabled
methods.docu: In BBj 24.01 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether or not this application is enabled for desktop deployment.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_isDesktopEnabled.htm)

methods.name: isQuiet
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether quiet mode was specified.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_isQuiet.html)

methods.name: toAppConfig
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns an editable BBjAppConfig object with the same settings as this immutable BBjApplication. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjapplication/BBjApplication_toAppConfig.html)

classes.name: BBjJettyContextController
classes.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, this class provides an administrator program the
 ability to control individual contexts within the running BBJ Web Server.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjjettycontextcontroller/BBjJettyContextController.htm)

methods.name: start
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method starts context associated to this BBjJettyContextController. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjjettycontextcontroller/BBjJettyContextController_start.htm)

methods.name: stop
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method stops context associatd to this BBjJettyContextController. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjjettycontextcontroller/BBjJettyContextController_stop.htm)

methods.name: restart
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method restarts context associated to this BBjJettyContextController. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjjettycontextcontroller/BBjJettyContextController_restart.htm)

methods.name: isStarted
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean value that indicates whether the context has been started. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjjettycontextcontroller/BBjJettyContextController_isStarted.htm)

classes.name: BBjAdminEnvironment
classes.docu: In BBj 5.0 and higher, the BBjAdminEnvironment object provides programmatic access to the BBjServices environment. This may affect other BBj clients. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadminenvironment/bbjadminenvironment.htm)

methods.name: getClasspath
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this BBjAdminEnvironment method returns a vector containing the configured classpath elements for the given session-specific classpath name. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadminenvironment/bbjadminenvironment_getclasspath.htm)

methods.name: getFullClasspath
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this BBjAdminEnvironment method returns a vector containing all the classpath elements that affect a session using the given session specific classpath name. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadminenvironment/bbjadminenvironment_getfullclasspath.htm)

methods.name: reloadClasspath
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this BBjAdminEnvironment method instructs BBjServices to reload any jar files on the session specific classpath with the given name. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadminenvironment/bbjadminenvironment_reloadclasspath.htm)

methods.name: setClasspath
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this BBjAdminEnvironment method configures the value of a classpath name. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadminenvironment/bbjadminenvironment_setclasspath.htm)

methods.name: unpinAllPrograms
methods.docu: In BBj 5.0 and higher, this method unpins all programs BBjServices program cache. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadminenvironment/bbjadminenvironment_unpinallprograms.htm)

methods.name: unpinServer
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this BBjAdminEnvironment method replaces deprecated BBjAdminEnvironment::unpinAllPrograms. This method unpins programs and resources pinned in the server-wide cache; this does not affect programs or resources pinned with session pinning. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjadminenvironment/bbjadminenvironment_unpinserver.htm)

classes.name: BBjServletRegistry
classes.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, the BBjServlet registry 
allows publishing applications as a BBjServlet. Applications published 
this way are available through the web server.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjservletregistry/bbjservletregistry.htm)

methods.name: publish
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method publishes a servlet to the web server 
 path. If no context is specified, then the root context is assumed.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjservletregistry/BBjServletRegistry_publish.htm)

methods.name: publish
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method publishes a servlet to the web server 
 path. If no context is specified, then the root context is assumed.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjservletregistry/BBjServletRegistry_publish.htm)

methods.name: unpublish
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method removes a published servlet from 
 the web server. If no context is specified, then the root context is assumed.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjservletregistry/BBjServletRegistry_unpublish.htm)

methods.name: unpublish
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method removes a published servlet from 
 the web server. If no context is specified, then the root context is assumed.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjservletregistry/BBjServletRegistry_unpublish.htm)

classes.name: BBjFormatMappingAction
classes.docu: In BBj 8.0 and higher, BBjFormatMappingAction converts values based on a format string. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjformatmappingaction/bbjformatmappingaction.htm)

methods.name: getFormat
methods.docu: In BBj 8.0 and higher, this method returns the format string. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjformatmappingaction/bbjformatmappingaction_getformat.htm)
