classes.name: BBjCookie
classes.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, BBjCookie 
 creates 
 a cookie, a small amount of information sent by a servlet to a Web browser, 
 saved by the browser, and later sent back to the server. A cookie's value 
 can uniquely identify a client, so cookies are commonly used for session 
 management.
                                            A 
 cookie has a name, a single value, and optional attributes such as a comment, 
 path and domain qualifiers, a maximum age, and a version number. Some 
 Web browsers have bugs in how they handle the optional attributes, so 
 use them sparingly to improve the interoperability of your servlets.
                                            The 
 servlet sends cookies to the browser which adds fields to HTTP response 
 headers to send cookies to the browser, one at a time. The browser is 
 expected to support 20 cookies for each Web server, 300 cookies total, 
 and may limit cookie size to 4 KB each.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/bbjcookie.htm)

methods.name: getComment
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the comment from the current 
 BBjCookie object.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/BBjCookie_getComment.htm)

methods.name: getDomain
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the domain within which 
 this cookie should be presented. The form of the domain name is specified 
 by RFC 2109. A domain name begins with a dot (.foo.com) and means that 
 the cookie is visible to servers in a specified Domain Name System (DNS) 
 zone (for example, www.foo.com, but not a.b.foo.com). By default, cookies 
 are only returned to the server that sent them.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/BBjCookie_getDomain.htm)

methods.name: getMaxAge
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the maximum age of the cookie, 
 specified in seconds, By default, -1 indicating the cookie will persist 
 until browser shutdown.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/BBjCookie_getMaxAge.htm)

methods.name: getName
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the name of the cookie. 
 The name cannot be changed after creation.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/BBjCookie_getName.htm)

methods.name: getPath
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the path on the server to which the browser returns this BBjCookie. The cookie is visible to all subpaths on the server. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/BBjCookie_getPath.htm)

methods.name: getSecure
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns 
 true if the browser is sending cookies only over a secure protocol, or 
 false if the browser can send cookies using any protocol.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/bbjcookie_getsecure.htm)

methods.name: getValue
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the value from the current BBjCookie object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/BBjCookie_getValue.htm)

methods.name: getVersion
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the version of the protocol 
 this cookie complies with. Version 1 complies with RFC 2109, and version 
 0 complies with the original cookie specification drafted by Netscape. 
 Cookies provided by a browser use and identify the browser's cookie version.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/BBjCookie_getVersion.htm)

methods.name: setComment
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method sets a comment that describes a 
 cookie's purpose. The comment is useful if the browser presents the cookie 
 to the user. Comments are not supported by Netscape Version 0 cookies.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/BBjCookie_setComment.htm)

methods.name: setDomain
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method sets the domain within which this 
 cookie should be presented. 
                                            The form of the domain name is specified by RFC 2109. A domain name 
 begins with a dot (.foo.com) and means that the cookie is visible to servers 
 in a specified Domain Name System (DNS) zone (for example, www.foo.com, 
 but not a.b.foo.com). By default, cookies are only returned to the server 
 that sent them.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/BBjCookie_setDomain.htm)

methods.name: setMaxAge
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method sets the maximum age of the cookie 
 in seconds. 
                                            A positive value indicates that the cookie will expire after that many 
 seconds have passed. Note that the value is the maximum age when the cookie 
 will expire, not the cookie's current age. 
                                            A negative value means that the cookie is not stored persistently and 
 will be deleted when the Web browser exits. A zero value causes the cookie 
 to be deleted.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/BBjCookie_setMaxAge.htm)

methods.name: setPath
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method sets the path for the cookie to which the client should return the BBjCookie. The cookie is visible to all the pages in the directory you specify, and all the pages in that directory's sub-directories. A cookie's path must include the servlet that set the cookie, for example, /catalog, which makes the cookie visible to all directories on the server under /catalog. Consult RFC 2109 (available on the Internet) for more information on setting path names for cookies. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/BBjCookie_setPath.htm)

methods.name: setSecure
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method indicates to the browser whether 
 the cookie should only be sent using a secure protocol, such as HTTPS 
 or SSL. 
                                            The default value is false.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/BBjCookie_setSecure.htm)

methods.name: setValue
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method sets a new value to a cookie after 
 the cookie is created. If you use a binary value, you may want to use 
 BASE64 encoding. * 
                                            With Version 0 cookies, values should not contain white space, brackets, 
 parentheses, equals signs, commas, double quotes, slashes, question marks, 
 at signs, colons, and semicolons. Empty values may not behave the same 
 way on all browsers.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/BBjCookie_setValue.htm)

methods.name: setVersion
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method sets the version of the cookie protocol this BBjCookie complies with. Version 0 complies with the original Netscape cookie specification. Version 1 complies with RFC 2109. Since RFC 2109 is still somewhat new, consider version 1 as experimental; do not use it yet on production sites. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/BBjCookie_setVersion.htm)

methods.name: setHttpOnly
methods.docu:
In BBj 18.04 and higher, this method indicates 
 that the cookie should only be sent over HTTP. It can be used to prevent 
 client-side scripts from accessing the cookie.
                                            The default value is false.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/bbjcookie_sethttponly.htm)

methods.name: isHttpOnly
methods.docu:
In BBj 18.04 and higher, this method returns 
 true if the cookie can only be sent over HTTP.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjcookie/bbjcookie_ishttponly.htm)

classes.name: BBjSysGui
classes.docu:
A BBjSysGui object is an object that represents a SYSGUI channel, which 
 is used to facilitate the creation and manipulation of custom graphical 
 windows and controls in a GUI application.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/BBjSysGui.htm)

methods.name: addPopupMenu

methods.name: addWindow

methods.name: beep
methods.docu: In BBj 15.0 and higher, this method emits an audio beep on the client.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/BBjSysGui_beep.htm)

methods.name: bufferWrites
methods.docu: Causes all writes to the SysGui device to be buffered until the flushWrites() method is called. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_bufferwrites.htm)

methods.name: createPopupMenu
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method creates a BBjPopupMenu from a resource file.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_createpopupmenu.htm)

methods.name: createRecordSet
methods.docu: Creates the BBjRecordSet identified by recordSetID from a resource file opened to resHandle.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/BBjSysGui_createRecordSet.htm)

methods.name: createTopLevelWindow
methods.docu:
Creates the top level window identified 
            by 
            <var>windowID</var>             on the client, including all controls 
within that window, from a resource file opened to <var>resHandle</var>.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_createtoplevelwindow.htm)

methods.name: executeScript
methods.docu: In BBj 21.10 and higher, this method executes the specified JavaScript in this web page (see Remarks). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/BBjSysGui_executeScript.htm)

methods.name: executeScript
methods.docu: In BBj 21.10 and higher, this method executes the specified JavaScript in this web page (see Remarks). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/BBjSysGui_executeScript.htm)

methods.name: flushEvents
methods.docu: Flushes all pending events from the queue.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_flushevents.htm)

methods.name: flushWrites
methods.docu: The BBjSysGui is automatically optimized to limit network traffic. Prior to BBj 5.0, the methods executes all writes that have occurred on the SysGui device since the bufferWrites() method was called. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_flushwrites.htm)

methods.name: getActiveContext
methods.docu: In BBj 2.01 and higher, this method returns the context ID of the current active or focused window.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getactivecontext.htm)

methods.name: getActiveWindow
methods.docu: In BBj 2.01 and higher, this method returns the window object of the current active or focused window.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getactivewindow.htm)

methods.name: getAvailableContext
methods.docu: Returns the next available context of the SysGui device.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getavailablecontext.htm)

methods.name: getChannel
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns the most recently opened SYSGUI 
channel number.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/BBjSysGui_getChannel.htm)

methods.name: getContext
methods.docu: Returns the context associated with the current window of the SysGui device.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getcontext.htm)

methods.name: getContextList
methods.docu: In BBj 24.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of integer context numbers for all active BBjWindow objects (BBjTopLevelWindow or BBjChildWindow). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/BBjSysGui_getContextList.htm)

methods.name: getDefaultScrollWheelBehavior
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method gets the scroll behavior of all MouseWheelEnabled controls that do not specify their own scroll mode. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getdefaultscrollwheelbehavior.htm)

methods.name: getImageManager
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns the BBjImageManager object associated with this BBjSysGui facade. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getimagemanager.htm)

methods.name: getLastEvent
methods.docu:
In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns the most recent event generated 
 in the current BBj session.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/BBjSysGui_getLastEvent.htm)

methods.name: getLastEventString
methods.docu: Returns the event string from the last event that was generated (for use with the CALLBACK verb). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getlasteventstring.htm)

methods.name: getMeasure
methods.docu: In BBj 11.0 and higher, this method returns the width in unscaled pixels of the specified string in the current active or focused window. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getmeasure.htm)

methods.name: getMeasures
methods.docu: In BBj 13.0 and higher, this method returns the widths in unscaled pixels of the specified strings in the current active or focused window. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getmeasures.htm)

methods.name: getMessageBatch
methods.docu: Returns a BBjBatch object, which is used to create and submit a batch of CTRL() and/or SENDMSG() functions. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getmessagebatch.htm)

methods.name: getPopupMenu
methods.docu: In BBj 8.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjPopupMenu associated with the specified ID. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getpopupmenu.htm)

methods.name: getRepaintEnabled
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns an indication of whether repaints are enabled for this BBjSysGui. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getrepaintenabled.htm)

methods.name: getScaleX
methods.docu: In BBj 15.0 and higher, this method returns the current x-axis scaling factor. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/BBjSysGui_getScaleX.htm)

methods.name: getScaleY
methods.docu: In BBj 15.0 and higher, this method returns the current y-axis scaling factor. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/BBjSysGui_getScaleY.htm)

methods.name: getSystemMetrics
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns the BBjSystemMetrics object associated with this BBjSysGui facade. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getsystemmetrics.htm)

methods.name: getWindow
methods.docu: Returns the BBjWindow object associated with the specified context. If the window is a top level window, it can be cast to a BBjTopLevelWindow with the CAST() Function(). If the window is a child window, then it can be cast to a BBjChildWindow. In BBj 8.0 and higher, this method can also return a window with a specified name. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getwindow.htm)

methods.name: getWindow
methods.docu: Returns the BBjWindow object associated with the specified context. If the window is a top level window, it can be cast to a BBjTopLevelWindow with the CAST() Function(). If the window is a child window, then it can be cast to a BBjChildWindow. In BBj 8.0 and higher, this method can also return a window with a specified name. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getwindow.htm)

methods.name: getWindows
methods.docu: In BBj 8.00 and higher, getWindows(string) returns a BBjVector of all existing BBjWindow objects (BBjTopLevelWindow or BBjChildWindow) with a specified name. In BBj 23.01 and higher, getWindows() returns a BBjVector of all existing BBjWindow objects (BBjTopLevelWindow or BBjChildWindow). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getwindows.htm)

methods.name: getWindows

In BBj 23.01 and higher, getWindows() returns a BBjVector of all existing BBjWindow objects (BBjTopLevelWindow or BBjChildWindow). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_getwindows.htm)

methods.name: injectScript
methods.docu: In BBj 21.10 and higher, this method injects the specified JavaScript into the web page (see Remarks), making it available for subsequent use by BBjSysGui::executeScript. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/BBjSysGui_injectScript.htm)

methods.name: isTouchSupported
methods.docu: In BBj 20.32 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether this device supports touch gestures.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/BBjSysGui_isTouchSupported.htm)

methods.docu: Creates a BBjColor object from the specified parameters.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_makecolor.htm)

methods.name: playSoundUrl
methods.docu: In BBj 22.0 and higher, this method plays the sound from a URL.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/BBjSysGui_playSoundUrl.htm)

methods.docu: In BBj 22.0 and higher, this method plays the sound from a URL.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/BBjSysGui_playSoundUrl.htm)

methods.name: removeImageList
methods.docu: In BBj 5.0 and higher, this method removes an imagelist created from addImageList. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_removeimagelist.htm)

methods.name: resClose
methods.docu: In BBj 2.03 and higher, this method closes a resource handle. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_resclose.htm)

methods.name: resOpen
methods.docu: Opens a resource file and returns a resource handle.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_resopen.htm)

methods.name: setContext
methods.docu: Sets the current context of the SysGui device to the specified context.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_setcontext.htm)

methods.name: setDefaultScrollWheelBehavior
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method sets the scroll behavior of all MouseWheelEnabled controls that do not specify their own scroll mode. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_setdefaultscrollwheelbehavior.htm)

methods.name: setLookAndFeel
methods.docu: In BBj 3.01 and higher, this method sets the look and feel of the BBjSysGui.  [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_setlookandfeel.htm)

methods.name: setRepaintEnabled
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this BBjSysGui method controls whether program action (such as adding controls or setting attributes of controls) will cause a repaint on the client display. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/bbjsysgui_setrepaintenabled.htm)

methods.name: setScale
methods.docu: In BBj 15.0 and higher, this method sets the scale used for controls created on the SYSGUI device. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/SysGui/bbjsysgui/BBjSysGui_setScale.htm)

classes.name: BBjSessionInfo
classes.docu:
A BBjSessionInfo provides information about a single session running 
 in BBj.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/bbjsessioninfo.htm)

methods.name: getUser
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the username of the user running the session described by the BBjSessionInfo. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/bbjsessioninfo_getuser.htm)

methods.name: getUnresponsiveTime
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the unresponsive time for the session described by this BBjSessionInfo. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/bbjsessioninfo_getunresponsivetime.htm)

methods.name: getID
methods.docu: This method returns a unique identifier for the session described by this BBjSessionInfo. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/bbjsessioninfo_getid.htm)

methods.name: getIPAddress
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the originating IPAddress for the session described by this BBjSessionInfo. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/bbjsessioninfo_getipaddress.htm)

methods.name: getConnectTime
methods.docu: In BBj 4.00 and higher, this method returns the connect time for the session described by this BBjSessionInfo. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/bbjsessioninfo_getconnecttime.htm)

methods.name: getProgramName
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the name of the program currently executing in the session described by this BBjSessionInfo. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/bbjsessioninfo_getprogramname.htm)

methods.name: getLineListing
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the line listing currently being executed in the session described by this BBjSessionInfo. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/BBjSessionInfo_getLineListing.htm)

methods.name: getProgramLine
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns a line listing for the line currently being executed in the session described by this BBjSessionInfo. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/bbjsessioninfo_getprogramline.htm)

methods.name: isBackground
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns an indication of whether the session described by this BBjSessionInfo is running in background. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/bbjsessioninfo_isbackground.htm)

methods.name: getGroupID
methods.docu: In BBj 10.0 and higher, this method returns a group identifier for the session group to which this BBjSession belongs. A group identifier is an integer value shared by an original BBj session and any child sessions started via SCALL, BACKGROUND, and newBBjSession. The group identifier is shared by processes inside an MDI Window and is the group identifier used by BBjAPI::getGroupNamespace. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/bbjsessioninfo_getgroupid.htm)

methods.name: getSessionID
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns a unique identifier for the session described by this BBjSessionInfo. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/bbjsessioninfo_getsessionid.htm)

methods.name: getTerminalID
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the terminal ID of the session described by this BBjSessionInfo. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/bbjsessioninfo_getterminalid.htm)

methods.name: getTerminalName
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the terminal name from the session described by this  BBjSessionInfo. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/BBjSessionInfo_getTerminalName.htm)

methods.name: getMessage
methods.docu: In BBj 16.0 and higher, this method returns a user-defined message from the session described by this BBjSessionInfo. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/BBjSessionInfo_getMessage.htm)

methods.name: getUserTime
methods.docu: In BBj 23.00 and higher, this method returns the CPU time in nanoseconds that the session described by this BBjSessionInfo has executed in user mode. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/BBjSessionInfo_getUserTime.htm)

methods.name: getCpuTime
methods.docu: In BBj 23.00 and higher, this method returns the total CPU time in nanoseconds that the session described by this BBjSessionInfo has executed. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjsessioninfo/BBjSessionInfo_getCpuTime.htm)

classes.name: BBjObjectTable
classes.docu: The BBjObjectTable provides access to a map of key value pairs that is accessible at all program levels.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjobjecttable/bbjobjecttable.htm)

methods.name: put
methods.docu: Places a key/value pair into the table.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjobjecttable/bbjobjecttable_put.htm)

methods.name: get
methods.docu: Retrieves a value from the table given a key.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjobjecttable/bbjobjecttable_get.htm)

methods.name: clear
methods.docu: Clears all key/value pairs from the table.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjobjecttable/bbjobjecttable_clear.htm)

methods.name: remove
methods.docu: Removes a key/value pair from the table.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjobjecttable/bbjobjecttable_remove.htm)

methods.name: size
methods.docu: In BBj 5.0 and higher, this method retrieves the number of keys in the table. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjobjecttable/bbjobjecttable_size.htm)

methods.name: getKeys
methods.docu: In BBj 5.0 and higher, this method retrieves all of the keys from the table. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjobjecttable/bbjobjecttable_getkeys.htm)

classes.name: BBjConstants
classes.docu:
In BBj 11.0 and higher, the BBjConstants object exposes constants related 
 to miscellaneous BBj features.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjconstants.htm)

classes.name: BBjRecordData
classes.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, the BBjRecordData object represents a single record in a record set. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjrecorddata/bbjrecorddata.htm)

methods.name: getFieldList
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the list of field names for a BBjRecordSet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjrecorddata/bbjrecorddata_getfieldlist.htm)

methods.name: getFieldValue
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the value of a given field in a record data object.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjrecorddata/bbjrecorddata_getfieldvalue.htm)

methods.name: setFieldValue
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method changes the value of a field in the specified BBjRecordData object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjrecorddata/bbjrecorddata_setfieldvalue.htm)

classes.name: BBjHttpResponse
classes.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, BBjHttpResponse controls how HTTP protocol related data is returned to the client when handling a BBjServletEvent. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/bbjhttpresponse.htm)

methods.name: addCookie
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns a new BBjCookie object with the name set. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_addCookie.htm)

methods.name: addHeader
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether 
 the named response header has already been set.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_addHeader.htm)

methods.name: containsHeader
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether 
 the named response header has already been set.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_containsHeader.htm)

methods.name: encodeRedirectURL
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method encodes the specified URL for use in the BBjHttpResponse::sendRedirect(String) method or, if encoding is not needed, returns the URL unchanged. The implementation of this method includes the logic to determine whether the session ID needs to be encoded in the URL. Because the rules for making this determination can differ from those used to decide whether to encode a normal link, this method is separated from the encodeURL method. All URLs sent to the BBjHttpResponse::sendRedirect(String) method should be run through this method. Otherwise, URL rewriting cannot be used with browsers which do not support cookies. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_encodeRedirectURL.htm)

methods.name: encodeURL
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method encodes the specified URL by including 
 the session ID in it, or, if encoding is not needed, returns the URL unchanged. 
 The implementation of this method includes the logic to determine whether 
 the session ID needs to be encoded in the URL. For example, if the browser 
 supports cookies, or session tracking is turned off, URL encoding is unnecessary. 
 
                                            For robust session tracking, all URLs emitted by a servlet should be 
 run through this method. Otherwise, URL rewriting cannot be used with 
 browsers which do not support cookies.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_encodeURL.htm)

methods.name: getCharacterEncoding
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the name of the character encoding (MIME charset) used for the body sent in this response. The character encoding may have been specified explicitly using the BBjHttpResponse::setCharacterEncoding(String) or BBjHttpResponse::setContentType(String) methods, or implicitly using the BBjHttpResponse::setLocale(Locale) method. Explicit specifications take precedence over implicit specifications. Calls made to these methods after the response has been committed have no effect on the character encoding. If no character encoding has been specified, ISO-8859-1 is returned. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_getCharacterEncoding.htm)

methods.name: getContentType
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the content type used for the MIME body sent in this response. The content type must have been specified using BBjHttpResponse::setContentType(String) before the response is committed. If no content type has been specified, this method returns null(). If a content type has been specified, and a character encoding has been explicitly or implicitly specified, the charset is included in the string returned. If no character encoding has been specified, the charset is omitted. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_getContentType.htm)

methods.name: getHeader
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the value of the response header with the given name. If a response header with the given name exists and contains multiple values, the value that was added first will be returned. This method considers only response headers set or added via BBjHttpResponse::setHeader(String, String) or BBjHttpResponse::addHeader(String, String), respectively. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_getHeader.htm)

methods.name: getHeaderNames
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector containing the names of the headers of this response. This method considers only response headers set or added via BBjHttpResponse::setHeader(String, String), BBjHttpResponse::addHeader(java.lang.String, java.lang.String), respectively. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_getHeaderNames.htm)

methods.name: getHeaders
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector containing all the values of the specified header from the BBjHttpResponse object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_getHeaders.htm)

methods.name: getLocale
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the Locale specified for this BBjHttpResponse using the setLocale(java.util.Locale) method. Calls made to BBjHttpResponse::setLocale(Locale) after the response is committed have no effect. If no locale has been specified, the container's default locale is returned. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_getLocale.htm)

methods.name: getStatus
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method gets the status code of the BBjHttpResponse object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_getStatus.htm)

methods.name: sendError
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method sends an error response to the client 
 using the specified status.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_sendError.htm)

methods.name: sendError
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method sends an error response to the client 
 using the specified status.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_sendError.htm)

methods.name: sendRedirect
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method sends a redirect to the client.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_sendRedirect.htm)

methods.name: setCharacterEncoding
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method sets the character encoding for the BBjHttpResponse object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_setCharacterEncoding.htm)

methods.name: setContentType
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method sets the MIME type for the BBjHttpResponse object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_setContentType.htm)

methods.name: setHeader
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method sets a response header with the 
 given name and value. If the header had already been set, the new value 
 overwrites the previous one. The containsHeader method can be used to 
 test for the presence of a header before setting its value.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_setHeader.htm)

methods.name: setLocale
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method sets the locale of the response. It also sets the response's character encoding appropriately for the locale, if the character encoding has not been explicitly set using BBjHttpResponse::setContentType(String) or BBjHttpResponse::setCharacterEncoding(String). This method may be called repeatedly to change locale and character encoding. It does not set the response's character encoding if it is called after BBjHttpResponse::setContentType(String) has been called with a charset specification or after BBjHttpResponse::setCharacterEncoding(String) has been called. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_setLocale.htm)

methods.name: setStatus
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method sets the status code for the BBjHttpResponse object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_setStatus.htm)

methods.name: setFile
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method sets a file for download.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpresponse/BBjHttpResponse_setFile.htm)

classes.name: BBjHttpRequest
classes.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, BBjHttpRequest object 
provides methods for querying the state of an HTTP request.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/bbjhttprequest.htm)

methods.name: getCharacterEncoding
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the character encoding used by the client to create this BBjHttpRequest. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getCharacterEncoding.htm)

methods.name: getContentLength
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the size in bytes of the body in this BBjHttpRequest. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getContentLength.htm)

methods.name: getContentType
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the MIME type of the body in this BBjHttpRequest [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getContentType.htm)

methods.name: getCookies
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the a BBjVector containing all the BBjCookie objects from the BBjHttpRequest object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getCookies.htm)

methods.name: getHeader
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the specified header value from the BBjHttpRequest object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getHeader.htm)

methods.name: getHeaderNames
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the a BBjVector containing all the header names from the BBjHttpRequest object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getHeaderNames.htm)

methods.name: getHeaders
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the a BBjVector containing all the values for the specified header in the BBjHttpRequest object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/bbjhttprequest_getheaders.htm)

methods.name: getLocalAddr
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the Internet protocol (IP) address of the interface on which the BBjHttpRequest was received. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getLocalAddr.htm)

methods.name: getLocale
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the preferred Locale that the client will accept content in, based on the Accept-Language header. If the client request doesn't provide an Accept-Language header, this method returns the default locale for the server. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getLocale.htm)

methods.name: getLocales
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the a BBjVector containing Locale objects indicating, in decreasing order starting with the preferred locale, the locales that are acceptable to the client based on the Accept-Language header. If the client request doesn't provide an Accept-Language header, this method returns an Enumeration containing one Locale, the default locale for the server. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getLocales.htm)

methods.name: getLocalName
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the host name of the Internet protocol (IP) interface on which the BBjHttpRequest was received. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getLocalName.htm)

methods.name: getLocalPort
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the Internet protocol (IP) port number of the interface on which the BBjHttpRequest was received. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getLocalPort.htm)

methods.name: getMethod
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this 
 method returns the name of the HTTP method with which this request was 
 made.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/bbjhttprequest_getmethod.htm)

methods.name: getParameter
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the value of the named request 
 parameter as a string.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getParameter.htm)

methods.name: getParameterNames
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector, containing the 
 names of all the parameters passed in by this request.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getParameterNames.htm)

methods.name: getParameterValues
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns all of the parameter values 
 associated with this parameter name.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getParameterValues.htm)

methods.name: getPathInfo
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns any extra path information associated with the URL the client sent when it made this BBjHttpRequest. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getPathInfo.htm)

methods.name: getProtocol
getQueryString
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns 
 the 
query string that is contained in the request URL after the path.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getQueryString.htm)

methods.name: getRemoteAddr
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the Internet protocol (IP) address of the client or last proxy that sent the BBjHttpRequest. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getRemoteAddr.htm)

methods.name: getRemoteHost
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the fully qualified name 
 of the client or the last proxy that sent the request. If the engine cannot 
 or chooses not to resolve the hostname (to improve performance), this 
 method returns the dotted-string form of the IP address.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getRemoteHost.htm)

methods.name: getRemotePort
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the port number to which 
 the request was sent.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getRemotePort.htm)

methods.name: getRemoteUser
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the login of the user making 
 this request, if the user has been authenticated, or null() if the user 
 has not been authenticated.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getRemoteUser.htm)

methods.name: getRequestedSessionId
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the session ID specified 
 by the client.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getRequestedSessionId.htm)

methods.name: getRequestURI
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the part of this request's URL from the protocol name up to the query string in the first line of the BBjHttpRequest. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getRequestURI.htm)

methods.name: getRequestURL
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the URL the client used in the BBjHttpRequest. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getRequestURL.htm)

methods.name: getScheme
getServerName
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the host-name of the server 
 to which the request was sent. It is the value of the part before ":" 
 in the Host header value, if any, or the resolved server name, or the 
 server IP address.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getServerName.htm)

methods.name: getServerPort
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the port number to which 
 the request was sent. It is the value of the part after ":" 
 in the Host header value, if any, or the server port upon which the client 
 connection was accepted.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getServerPort.htm)

methods.name: getServletPath
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the part of this request's 
 URL that calls the servlet.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getServletPath.htm)

methods.name: getSession
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the BBjHttpSession associated with the BBjHttpRequest. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getSession.htm)

methods.name: isRequestedSessionIdFromCookie
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method checks whether the requested session 
 ID came in as a cookie.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_isRequestedSessionIdFromCookie.htm)

methods.name: isRequestedSessionIdFromURL
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method checks whether the requested session 
 ID came in as part of the request URL.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_isRequestedSessionIdFromURL.htm)

methods.name: isRequestedSessionIdValid
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method checks whether the requested session 
 ID is still valid.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_isRequestedSessionIdValid.htm)

methods.name: isSecure
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether 
 this request was made using a secure channel, such as HTTPS.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_isSecure.htm)

methods.name: getFileUploads
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of BBjFileUpload objects that have been posted and available in a BBjHttpRequest object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getFileUploads.htm)

methods.name: getFileUpload
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjFileUpload object available in a BBjHttpRequest object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getFileUpload.htm)

methods.name: getBody
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjString object which contains the body of a POSTed request to a servlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/BBjHttpRequest_getBody.htm)

methods.name: getAttribute
methods.docu: In BBj 15.00 and higher, this method returns the value of the named attribute as an Object, or null() if no attribute of the given name exists. Attributes can be set using BBjHttpRequest::setAttribute(). This allows information to be embedded into a request before a RequestDispatcher call. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/bbjhttprequest_getattribute.htm)

methods.name: getAttributeNames
methods.docu:
In BBj 15.00 and higher, this method returns 
 a BBjVector containing the names of the attributes available to this request. 
 This method returns an empty BBjVector if the request has no attributes 
 available to it.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/bbjhttprequest_getattributenames.htm)

methods.name: removeAttribute
methods.docu:
In BBj 15.00 and higher, this method removes 
 an attribute from this request. This method is not generally needed as 
 attributes only persist as long as the request is being handled.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/bbjhttprequest_removeattribute.htm)

methods.name: setAttribute
methods.docu: In BBj 15.00 and higher, this method stores an attribute in this request. Attributes are reset between requests. This method is most often used in conjunction with BBjHttpResponse::sendRedirect. Attribute names should follow the same conventions as package names. If the object passed in is null(), the effect is the same as calling BBjHttpRequest::removeAttribute(String). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttprequest/bbjhttprequest_setattribute.htm)

classes.name: BBjBuiAppCloseAction
classes.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, the BBjBuiAppCloseAction object provides an interface to chain to another BUI or DWC application on termination of a BUI or DWC application.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiAppCloseAction/BBjBuiAppCloseAction.htm)

methods.name: getActionType
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns an integer constant identifying the type of this close action (ACTION_APP). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiAppCloseAction/BBjBuiAppCloseAction_getActionType.htm)

methods.name: getActionTypeString
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns a string constant identifying the type of this close action (ACTION_APP). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiAppCloseAction/BBjBuiAppCloseAction_getActionTypeString.htm)

methods.name: getAppName
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns the BUI or DWC application name to be run from this close action.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiAppCloseAction/bbjbuiappcloseaction_getappname.htm)

classes.name: BBjBuiCloseAction
classes.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, the BBjBuiCloseAction object provides an interface to configure the termination actions of a BUI or DWC application.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiCloseAction/bbjbuicloseaction.htm)

methods.name: getActionTypeString
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns a string constant identifying the type of this close action.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiCloseAction/BBjBuiCloseAction_getActionTypeString.htm)

methods.name: getActionType
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns an integer constant identifying the type of this close action.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiCloseAction/bbjbuicloseAction_getactiontype.htm)

classes.name: BBjAppConfig
classes.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, a BBjAppConfig object is used to configure a BUI BBjApplication in preparation for publishing it to the BBjAppServer. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/bbjappconfig.htm)

methods.name: buildApplication
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjApplication object with the values specified in this BBjAppConfig. This next step would normally be to publish the BBjApplication to the BBjAppServer. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_buildApplication.html)

methods.name: clearClientPollInterval
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method clears any application-specific setting and uses the server's default setting for the length of time in seconds the web server will wait for the next command from BBjServices.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_clearClientPollInterval.html)

methods.name: clearDevelopmentMode
methods.docu:
In BBj 16.0 
            and higher, this method clears any application-specific development mode 
            setting and uses the server's default setting.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_clearDevelopmentMode.htm)

methods.name: clearDisallowConsole
methods.docu: In BBj 19.10 and higher, this method clears any application-specific setting for whether console access should be disallowed for this application, and uses the server's default setting instead. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_clearDisallowConsole.htm)

methods.name: clearEndAction
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method clears any application-specific setting and uses the server's default application termination action.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_clearEndAction.html)

methods.name: clearErrAction
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method clears any application-specific setting and uses the server's default application error termination action.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_clearErrAction.html)

methods.name: clearManageBrowserHistory
methods.docu:
In BBj 16.0 
            and higher, this method clears any application-specific setting for managing 
            browser history and uses the server's default setting.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_clearManageBrowserHistory.htm)

methods.name: clearOmitBasisCss
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method clears any application-specific 
 setting and uses the server's default OmitBasisCss setting.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_clearOmitBasisCss.htm)

methods.name: clearSecure
methods.docu:
In BBj 19.10 and higher, this method clears any application-specific 
 setting and uses the server's default setting for whether this application 
 should be started in secure mode.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_clearSecure.htm)

methods.name: clearSessionTimeout
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method clears any application-specific setting and uses the server's default setting for the length of time in seconds a BUI session will be considered active.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_clearSessionTimeout.html)

methods.name: clearShowBrowserWarning
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method clears any application-specific setting and uses the server's default setting for whether to show a browser warning the first time the user attempts to run a BUI application in Internet Explorer 8.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_clearShowBrowserWarning.html)

methods.name: clearShowClientConfirmationDialog
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method clears any application-specific setting and uses the server's default setting for whether to show a confirmation dialog when the user attempts to leave the application's page.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_clearShowClientConfirmationDialog.html)

methods.name: getApplicationIcon
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjResourceUrl representing a URL for the application's icon. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getApplicationIcon.html)

methods.name: getApplicationUserName
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the application user name, which corresponds to the BBj -n parameter.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getApplicationUserName.html)

methods.name: getBBjApplicationName
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the application name, which 
 corresponds to the BBj -a parameter.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getBBjApplicationName.html)

methods.name: getClasspathName
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the application classpath name.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getClasspathName.html)

methods.name: getClientPollInterval
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method is the length of time in seconds the web server will wait for the next command from the server. The default value is 50 seconds. If the web server does not receive a command from BBjServices in the configured time period, it will send a heartbeat to the browser.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getClientPollInterval.html)

methods.name: getConfigFile
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the config.bbx file name.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getConfigFile.html)

methods.name: getDevelopmentMode
methods.docu: In BBj 16.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether this BUI app should be run in development mode. The default value is false. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getDevelopmentMode.htm)

methods.name: getDisallowConsole
methods.docu:
In BBj 19.10 
and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether this BUI 
app is set to disallow console access.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getDisallowConsole.htm)

methods.name: getEndAction
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns the action that occurs on normal application termination.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getEndAction.html)

methods.name: getErrAction
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns the action that occurs on abnormal application termination.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getErrAction.html)

methods.name: getInterpreterUser
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the interpreter user name, which corresponds to the BBj -u command line parameter.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getInterpreterUser.html)

methods.name: getLoadImage
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjResourceUrl representing the application's load image. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getLoadImage.html)

methods.name: getManageBrowserHistory
methods.docu: In BBj 16.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether BUI will manage this app's browser history. The default value is false . [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getManageBrowserHistory.htm)

methods.name: getOmitBasisCss
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether this BUI app 
should be run without the default BASIS CSS. The default value is false.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getOmitBasisCss.htm)

methods.name: getProgramArguments
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the user-defined program 
 arguments for this program.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getProgramArguments.html)

methods.name: getProgramName
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the BBj program name for this application.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getProgramName.html)

methods.name: getSecure
methods.docu:
In BBj 19.10 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether 
 this application should be started in secure mode. The default value is 
 false.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getSecure.htm)

methods.name: getSessionTimeout
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the number of seconds a non-responsive BUI application will be considered active. If this time passes with no response, the web tier will send a NET_DROPPED error back to the server. The default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes). -1 corresponds to no timeout. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getSessionTimeout.html)

methods.name: getShowBrowserWarning
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether a browser warning page should be shown the first time the user attempts to run a BUI application in Internet Explorer 8. The default value is true. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getShowBrowserWarning.html)

methods.name: getShowClientConfirmationDialog
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether to display a confirmation dialog when the user attempts to leave the application's page. The default value is  true. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getShowClientConfirmationDialog.html)

methods.name: getStyleSheet
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjResourceUrl object representing the URL for an application's style sheet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getStyleSheet.html)

methods.name: getTerminal
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the terminal ID to be used for this application.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getTerminal.html)

methods.name: getWorkingDirectory
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the application working directory.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_getWorkingDirectory.html)

methods.name: isBuiEnabled
methods.docu: In BBj 21.10 and higher, this method returns whether this application is enabled in the BUI client.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_isBuiEnabled.htm)

methods.name: isDwcEnabled
methods.docu: In BBj 21.10 and higher, this method returns whether this application is enabled in the DWC client.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_isDwcEnabled.html)

methods.name: isDesktopEnabled
methods.docu: In BBj 24.01 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether or not this application is enabled for desktop deployment.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_isDesktopEnabled.htm)

methods.name: isQuiet
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns whether this application should be started in quiet mode.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_isQuiet.html)

methods.name: makeCopy
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method makes a copy of this BBjAppConfig. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_makeCopy.html)

methods.name: setApplicationIcon
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets the icon to appear in the browser tab beside the application name.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setApplicationIcon.html)

methods.name: setApplicationUserName
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this methods sets the application user name, which corresponds to the BBj -n parameter. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setApplicationUserName.html)

methods.name: setBBjApplicationName
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets the application name, which corresponds to the BBj -a parameter.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setBBjApplicationName.html)

methods.name: setBuiEnabled
methods.docu: In BBj 21.10 and higher, this method sets whether this application is enabled in the BUI client.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setBuiEnabled.htm)

methods.name: setClasspathName
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets the application classpath.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setClasspathName.html)

methods.name: setClientPollInterval
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets the length of time in seconds the web server will wait for the next command from BBjServices. If the web server does not receive a command from the server in the configured time period, it will send a heartbeat to the browser.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setClientPollInterval.html)

methods.name: setConfigFile
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets the config.bbx file name for this application.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setConfigFile.html)

methods.name: setDevelopmentMode
methods.docu:
In BBj 16.0 
            and higher, this method sets whether this BUI app should be run in development 
            mode.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setDevelopmentMode.htm)

methods.name: setDisallowConsole
methods.docu:
In BBj 19.10 
and higher, this method sets whether this BUI app should disallow console 
access.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setDisallowConsole.htm)

methods.name: setDwcEnabled
methods.docu: In BBj 21.10 and higher, this methods sets whether this application is enabled in the DWC client.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setDwcEnabled.html)

methods.name: setDesktopEnabled
methods.docu: In BBj 24.01 and higher, this method sets whether or not this application is enabled for desktop deployment.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setDesktopEnabled.htm)

methods.name: setEndAction
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method sets the action that will occur 
 on normal application termination.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setEndAction.html)

methods.name: setErrAction
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method sets the action that will occur on abnormal application termination.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setErrAction.html)

methods.name: setInterpreterUser
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets the interpreter user name, which corresponds to the BBj -u command line parameter.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setInterpreterUser.html)

methods.name: setLoadImage
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this methods sets a custom load image (splash screen) for this application. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setLoadImage.html)

methods.name: setManageBrowserHistory
methods.docu:
In BBj 16.0 
            and higher, this method sets whether BUI should manage this app's browser 
            history.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setManageBrowserHistory.htm)

methods.name: setOmitBasisCss
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method sets whether this BUI app should be run 
without the default BASIS CSS.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setOmitBasisCss.htm)

methods.name: setProgramArguments
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets user-defined program arguments.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setProgramArguments.html)

methods.name: setProgramName
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets the BBj program name.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setProgramName.html)

methods.name: setQuiet
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this methods sets whether this application should be started in quiet mode. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setQuiet.html)

methods.name: setSecure
methods.docu:
In BBj 19.10 and higher, this method sets whether this application should 
 be started in secure mode. The default value is false.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setSecure.htm)

methods.name: setSessionTimeout
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets the length of time in seconds a non-responsive BUI session will be considered active. If this time passes with no response, the web tier will send a NET_DROPPED error back to the server. The default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes). -1 corresponds to no timeout. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setSessionTimeout.html)

methods.name: setShowBrowserWarning
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets whether to display a browser 
 warning the first time the user attempts to run a BUI application in Internet 
 Explorer 8.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setShowBrowserWarning.html)

methods.name: setShowClientConfirmationDialog
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets whether to display a confirmation dialog when the user attempts to leave the application's page.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setShowClientConfirmationDialog.html)

methods.name: setStyleSheet
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets a custom style sheet with the CSS file represented by BBjResourceUrl. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setStyleSheet.html)

methods.name: setTerminal
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets this application's terminal alias.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setTerminal.html)

methods.name: setWorkingDirectory
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets this application's working directory.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappconfig/BBjAppConfig_setWorkingDirectory.html)

classes.name: BBjClientFile
classes.docu:
The BBjClientFile object provides developers methods to manipulate a 
 specific client-side file.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile.htm)

methods.name: canExecute
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this BBjClientFile method returns whether the client file is executable. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_canexecute.htm)

methods.name: canRead
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this BBjClientFile method returns whether the client file can be read. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_canread.htm)

methods.name: canWrite
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns whether the file exists and whether BBj has write access to the file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_canwrite.htm)

methods.name: copyFromClient
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method copies the file this BBjClientFile represents to the server and returns the name of the file to which it was copied.

In BBj 14.0 and higher, a server directory or fully-qualified server filename may be specified. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_copyfromclient.htm)

methods.name: copyFromClient
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method copies the file this BBjClientFile represents to the server and returns the name of the file to which it was copied.

In BBj 14.0 and higher, a server directory or fully-qualified server filename may be specified. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_copyfromclient.htm)

methods.name: copyToClient
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method copies the specified file from the server to the client. The BBjClientFile represents the file on the client to which it will be copied. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_copytoclient.htm)

methods.name: createNewFile
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method will create the file represented by this BBjClientFile. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_createnewfile.htm)

methods.name: delete
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method deletes the file the BBjClientFile. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_delete.htm)

methods.name: exists
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns whether the file this BBjClientFile represents exists. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_exists.htm)

methods.name: getCanonicalFile
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjClientFile that represents the "canonical" file represented by this BBjClientFile. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_getcanonicalfile.htm)

methods.name: getContents
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the contents of the file this BBjClientFile represents. If the file does not exist, it reports !ERROR=12. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_getcontents.htm)

methods.name: getName
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the last path component in a file name (the simple file name). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_getname.htm)

methods.name: getParent
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjClientFile that represents the directory containing this BBjClientFile. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_getparent.htm)

methods.name: getPath
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the absolute path of the file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_getpath.htm)

methods.name: isDirectory
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns whether this BBjClientFile represents a directory. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_isdirectory.htm)

methods.name: isFile
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns whether this BBjClientFile represents a normal file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_isfile.htm)

methods.name: isHidden
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this BBjClientFile method returns whether this file is considered hidden by the operating system. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_ishidden.htm)

methods.name: lastModified
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this BBjClientFile method returns the time at which this file was last modified in milliseconds. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_lastmodified.htm)

methods.name: listFiles
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this BBjClientFile method returns a vector containing the list of the files in a directory. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_listfiles.htm)

methods.name: mkdir
