methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this BBjClientFile method creates a directory named by this BBjClientFile. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_mkdir.htm)

methods.name: mkdirs
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method creates a directory at the path named by this BBjClientFile. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_mkdirs.htm)

methods.name: renameTo
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method renames the file represented by this BBjClientFile to the specified value. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_renameto.htm)

methods.name: setContents
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method sets the contents of the file this BBjClientFile represents. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_setcontents.htm)

methods.name: setExecutable
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this BBjClientFile method sets the executable state on the client file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_setexecutable.htm)

methods.name: setLastModified
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method sets the last modified time of the file this BBjClientFile represents. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_setlastmodified.htm)

methods.name: setReadable
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this BBjClientFile method sets the readable state on the client file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_setreadable.htm)

methods.name: setReadOnly
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this BBjClientFile method sets the file to read-only. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_setreadonly.htm)

methods.name: setWritable
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this BBjClientFile method sets the writable state on the client file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_setwritable.htm)

methods.name: size
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this BBjClientFile method returns the size of the file in bytes. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjclientfile/bbjclientfile_size.htm)

classes.name: BBjStackElement
classes.docu:
In BBj 9.0 and higher, the BBjStackElement provides information about 
 one level on the BBj stack.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjstackelement/bbjstackelement.htm)

methods.name: getFileName
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method returns the filename of the program at the stack level represented by the BBjStackElement. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjstackelement/bbjstackelement_getfilename.htm)

methods.name: getClassName
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method returns the className of the CustomObject at the stack level that the BBjStackElement represents. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjstackelement/bbjstackelement_getclassname.htm)

methods.name: getMethodName
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method returns the methodName of the CustomObject at the stack level that the BBjStackElement represents. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjstackelement/bbjstackelement_getmethodname.htm)

methods.name: getPhysicalLineNumber
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method returns the physical line number at the stack level that the BBjStackElement represents. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjstackelement/bbjstackelement_getphysicallinenumber.htm)

methods.name: getUserLineNumber
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method returns the user line number at the stack level the BBjStackElement represents. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjstackelement/bbjstackelement_getuserlinenumber.htm)

methods.name: getLineListing
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method returns the line listing at the stack level that this BBjStackElement represents. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjstackelement/bbjstackelement_getlinelisting.htm)

methods.name: toString
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method returns a string representation of this BBjStackElement. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjstackelement/bbjstackelement_tostring.htm)

classes.name: BBjWindowValues
classes.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, the BBjWindowValues object returns the values of all simple controls on a given BBjTopLevelWindow in a single operation, minimizing network overhead across distributed client/server connections. Complex controls containing multiple values (like grids) are not included in this data structure. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Window/BBjWindowValues/BBjWindowValues.htm)

methods.name: getMap
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns 
a data structure containing the text values of all controls on the top 
level window.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Window/BBjWindowValues/BBjWindowValues_getMap.htm)

methods.name: getText
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns the text value of a specific control from the set of all text values returned in a BBjWindowValues object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Window/BBjWindowValues/BBjWindowValues_getText.htm)

methods.name: getSelectedIndex
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns 
the index corresponding to the returned text value of a list control.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Window/BBjWindowValues/BBjWindowValues_getSelectedIndex.htm)

methods.name: getValue
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns the numeric value of a specific control from the set of all values returned in a BBjWindowValues object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Window/BBjWindowValues/BBjWindowValues_getValue.htm)

methods.name: getValue
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns the numeric value of a specific control from the set of all values returned in a BBjWindowValues object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Window/BBjWindowValues/BBjWindowValues_getValue.htm)

methods.name: getValue
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns the numeric value of a specific control from the set of all values returned in a BBjWindowValues object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Window/BBjWindowValues/BBjWindowValues_getValue.htm)

methods.name: getValue
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns the numeric value of a specific control from the set of all values returned in a BBjWindowValues object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Window/BBjWindowValues/BBjWindowValues_getValue.htm)

methods.name: isSelected
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns a boolean value indicating whether a BBjCheckBox or BBjRadioButton control was selected when this BBjWindowValues object was captured. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Window/BBjWindowValues/BBjWindowValues_isSelected.htm)

classes.name: BBjHttpSession
classes.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, BBjHttpSession provides 
session-specific storage for HTTP sessions.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpsession/bbjhttpsession.htm)

methods.name: getAttribute
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the specified attribute value from the BBjHttpSession object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpsession/BBjHttpSession_getAttribute.htm)

methods.name: getAttributeNames
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the a BBjVector containing all the attribute names from the BBjHttpSession object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpsession/BBjHttpSession_getAttributeNames.htm)

methods.name: getCreationTime
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the time that a session 
 was created.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpsession/BBjHttpSession_getCreationTime.htm)

methods.name: getId
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the ID for the current BBjHttpSession. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpsession/BBjHttpSession_getId.htm)

methods.name: getLastAccessedTime
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the last time that a session 
 was accessed.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpsession/BBjHttpSession_getLastAccessedTime.htm)

methods.name: getMaxInactiveInterval
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns the maximum time interval, 
 in seconds, that the servlet container will keep this session open between 
 client accesses.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpsession/BBjHttpSession_getMaxInactiveInterval.htm)

methods.name: invalidate
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method invalidates the current BBjHttpSession. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpsession/BBjHttpSession_invalidate.htm)

methods.name: isNew
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method returns 
true if the client does not yet know about the session or if the client 
chooses not to join the session.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpsession/BBjHttpSession_isNew.htm)

methods.name: removeAttribute
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method removes the object bound with the specified name from this BBjHttpSession. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpsession/BBjHttpSession_removeAttribute.htm)

methods.name: setAttribute
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method binds an object to this BBjHttpSession using the name specified. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpsession/BBjHttpSession_setAttribute.htm)

methods.name: setMaxInactiveInterval
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method sets the maximum time interval, 
 in seconds, that the servlet container will keep this session open between 
 client accesses.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpsession/BBjHttpSession_setMaxInactiveInterval.htm)

methods.name: getContext
methods.docu: In BBj 15.00 and higher, this method returns the BBjJettyContext for this session. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Servlet/bbjhttpsession/BBjHttpSession_getContext.htm)

classes.name: BBjTemplatedString
classes.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this object provides the functionality of the traditional templated string and can be used throughout BBj in places where a templated string can be used. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring.htm)

methods.name: clear
methods.docu: In BBj 16.0 and higher, this method clears this BBjTemplatedString, resetting all fields to their initial default values. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/BBjTemplatedString_clear.htm)

methods.name: fattr
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the template used to create this BBjTemplatedString. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_fattr.htm)

methods.name: getFieldAsNumber
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the numeric value stored in a specified field of a BBjTemplatedString. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_getfieldasnumber.htm)

methods.name: getFieldAsNumber
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the numeric value stored in a specified field of a BBjTemplatedString. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_getfieldasnumber.htm)

methods.name: getFieldAsString
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the string value stored in a specified field of a BBjTemplatedString. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_getfieldasstring.htm)

methods.name: getFieldAsString
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the string value stored in a specified field of a BBjTemplatedString. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_getfieldasstring.htm)

methods.name: getFieldAttribute
methods.docu: In BBj 11.0 and higher, this method returns the value of a user-defined attribute associated with a specified field of aBBjTemplatedString. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_getfieldattribute.htm)

methods.name: getFieldLength
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns the defined length of a BBjTemplatedString field. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_getfieldlength.htm)

methods.name: getFieldNames
methods.docu: In BBj 11.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector containing the names of fields in a BBjTemplatedString. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_getfieldnames.htm)

methods.name: getFieldRepeat
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns the repeat count of a BBjTemplatedString field. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_getfieldrepeat.htm)

methods.name: getFieldTerminator
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns the terminator of a BBjTemplatedString field. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_getfieldterminator.htm)

methods.name: getFieldType
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method return the field type of a BBjTemplatedString field. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_getfieldtype.htm)

methods.name: getReconciledString
methods.docu: In BBj 16.0 and higher, this method returns the string value of the BBjTemplatedString after reconciling it to the template. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/BBjTemplatedString_getReconciledString.htm)

methods.name: getString
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the string value stored in the BBjTemplatedString. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_getstring.htm)

methods.name: getTerminatedFieldNumber
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns the field number of a BBjTemplatedString field, as defined by linefeed terminators. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_getterminatedfieldnumber.htm)

methods.name: getTerminatedFieldOffset
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns the zero-based offset of a BBjTemplatedString field since the beginning of the most recent linefeed-terminated field. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_getterminatedfieldoffset.htm)

methods.name: isFieldByteSwapped
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns whether the specified BBjTemplatedString field was defined with byte swapping. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_isfieldbyteswapped.htm)

methods.name: isFieldEOSTerminated
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns whether the specified BBjTemplatedString field is variable length terminated by the end of the string. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_isfieldeosterminated.htm)

methods.name: isFieldLongSwapped
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns whether the specified BBjTemplatedString field was defined with long swapping. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_isfieldlongswapped.htm)

methods.name: isFieldPadded
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns whether the specified BBjTemplatedString field is padded. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_isfieldpadded.htm)

methods.name: isFieldTerminated
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns whether the specified BBjTemplatedString field is terminated. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_isfieldterminated.htm)

methods.name: isFieldTerminatorEscaped
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns whether the specified BBjTemplatedString field is variable length with the terminator escaped. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_isfieldterminatorescaped.htm)

methods.name: isFieldWordSwapped
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method returns whether the specified BBjTemplatedString field was defined with word swapping. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_isfieldwordswapped.htm)

methods.name: setFieldValue
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method sets the value of a specified field in the BBjTemplatedString. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_setfieldvalue.htm)

methods.name: setFieldValue
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method sets the value of a specified field in the BBjTemplatedString. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_setfieldvalue.htm)

methods.name: setFieldValue
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method sets the value of a specified field in the BBjTemplatedString. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_setfieldvalue.htm)

methods.name: setFieldValue
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method sets the value of a specified field in the BBjTemplatedString. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_setfieldvalue.htm)

methods.name: setString
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method sets the string value stored in the BBjTemplatedString. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjtemplatedstring/bbjtemplatedstring_setstring.htm)

classes.name: BBjMDIBorder
classes.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, the BBjMDIBorder object provides methods for manipulating a BBjMDIBorder. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjmdiborder/bbjmdiborder.htm)

methods.name: setWindow
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method sets a BBjTopLevelWindow to reside in a BBjMDIBorder. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjmdiborder/bbjmdiborder_setwindow.htm)

methods.name: setWindow
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method sets a BBjTopLevelWindow to reside in a BBjMDIBorder. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjmdiborder/bbjmdiborder_setwindow.htm)

methods.name: getPosition
methods.docu: In BBj 4.0 and higher, this method returns the location of the BBjMDIBorder. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjmdiborder/bbjmdiborder_getposition.htm)

classes.name: BBjBuiManager
classes.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, the BBjWebManager/BBjBuiManager object provides an interface
 to BUI and DWC application runtime settings.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/bbjbuimanager.htm)

methods.name: appAction
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method constructs a BBjBuiAppCloseAction object to a specified BUI application on termination of the current BUI application.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/bbjbuimanager_appaction.htm)

methods.name: defaultAction
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method constructs a BBjBuiDefaultCloseAction object to perform the default action on termination of a BUI or DWC application.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/BBjBuiManager_defaultaction.htm)

methods.name: getApplicationName
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns the registered BUI or DWC application name.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/BBjBuiManager_getApplicationName.htm)

methods.name: getBusyIndicator
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, the BBjBusyIndicator object provides an interface to an animated busy indicator with a developer-defined message.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/BBjBuiManager_getBusyIndicator.htm)

methods.name: getEndAction
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns details about the action that will occur when the current BUI or DWC application terminates normally.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/bbjbuimanager_getendaction.htm)

methods.name: getErrAction
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns details about the action that will occur when the current BUI or DWC application terminates with an error condition.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/bbjbuimanager_geterraction.htm)

methods.name: getShowConfirmCloseDialog
methods.docu:
In BBj 16.00 and higher, this method returns a boolean 
indicating whether the browser should show a confirm close dialog if the 
user navigates away from the page without closing the BUI or DWC application.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/BBjBuiManager_getShowConfirmCloseDialog.htm)

methods.name: getTitle
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns the title of the current 
 page.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/BBjBuiManager_getTitle.htm)

methods.name: getUrl
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns the URL of the current page.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/BBjBuiManager_getUrl.htm)

methods.name: isTouchSupported
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether this device supports touch gestures.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/BBjBuiManager_isTouchSupported.htm)

methods.name: msgAction
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method constructs a BBjBuiMsgCloseAction object to display a specified message on termination of the current BUI or DWC application.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/bbjbuimanager_msgaction.htm)

methods.name: noneAction
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method constructs a BBjBuiNoneCloseAction object to do nothing on termination of a BUI or DWC app.
[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/bbjbuimanager_noneaction.htm)

methods.name: setCallback
methods.docu:
In BBj 16.00 and higher, this method registers the callback routine for a specified BBjWebManager event. In BBj 24.11 and higher, this method registers the callback routine for a specified window event. These event type codes are defined by the window interface.
[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/BBjBuiManager_setCallback.htm)

methods.name: setEndAction
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method sets the action that will occur when the current BUI or DWC application terminates normally.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/bbjbuimanager_setendaction.htm)

methods.name: setErrAction

                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/bbjbuimanager_seterraction.htm)

methods.name: setShowConfirmCloseDialog
methods.docu:

method sets whether the browser should show a confirm close dialog if 
the user navigates away from the page without closing the BUI or DWC application.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiManager/BBjBuiManager_setShowConfirmCloseDialog.htm)

classes.name: BBjAppServer
classes.docu:
In BBj 10.0 and higher, the BBjAppServer is used to manage the BUI Application 
 Server; starting and stopping the server, publishing BUI applications, 
 and managing server resources and global configuration settings.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver.html)

methods.name: addApplicationIcon
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method adds the contents of the file represented by iconFileName to the set of static resources in the BBjAppServer. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_addapplicationicon.html)

methods.name: addStaticResource
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method adds the contents of the file represented byfileNameto the set of static resources in the BBjAppServer. If the MIME typemimeTypeis not specified, an automatically detected MIME type is used. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_addstaticresource.html)

methods.name: addStaticResource
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method adds the contents of the file represented byfileNameto the set of static resources in the BBjAppServer. If the MIME typemimeTypeis not specified, an automatically detected MIME type is used. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_addstaticresource.html)

methods.name: addStyleSheet
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, adds the contents of the file represented by styleSheetFileName, with the MIME type text/css, to the static resources in the BBjAppServer. This is equivalent to calling addStaticResource(styleSheetFileName, "text/css"). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_addstylesheet.html)

methods.name: getAllAppNames
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, returns the names of all applications publishedBBjAppServer. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_getallappnames.html)

methods.name: getApplication
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, returns a published application with the given name. If no application exists with the given name, this method will throw an exception.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_getapplication.html)

methods.name: getClientPollInterval
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this is the length of time in seconds the web server will wait for the next command from BBjServices. The default value is 50 seconds. If the web server does not receive a command from BBjServices in the configured time period, it will send a heartbeat to the browser.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_getclientpollinterval.html)

methods.name: getDevelopmentMode
methods.docu: In BBj 16.0 and higher,this method returns a boolean indicating whether to run BUI apps in development mode. The default value is false. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_getDevelopmentMode.htm)

methods.name: getDisallowConsole
methods.docu:
In BBj 19.10 and higher, this method 
returns a boolean indicating whether BUI apps are set to disallow console 
access.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_getDisallowConsole.htm)

methods.name: getEndAction
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method is the action that will occur on 
 normal application termination.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_getEndAction.html)

methods.name: getErrAction
methods.docu:
In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method is the action that will occur on 
 abnormal application termination.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_getErrAction.html)

methods.name: getManageBrowserHistory
methods.docu: In BBj 16.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether BUI will manage browser history. The default value is false. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_getManageBrowserHistory.htm)

methods.name: getOmitBasisCss
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether BUI apps should be run without the default BASIS CSS. The default value is false. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_getOmitBasisCss.htm)

methods.name: getSecure
methods.docu:
In BBj 19.10 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether 
 BUI apps should be run in secure mode. The default value is false.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_getSecure.htm)

methods.name: getSessionTimeout
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns the length of time in seconds a non-responsive BUI session will be considered active. If the session expires without response, the web tier will send a NET_DROPPED error back to the server. The default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes). -1 corresponds to no timeout.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_getsessiontimeout.html)

methods.name: getShowBrowserWarning
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether 
 to display a browser warning the first time the user attempts to run a 
 BUI application in Internet Explorer 8. The default value is true.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_getshowbrowserwarning.html)

methods.name: getShowClientConfirmationDialog
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this methods returns a boolean indicating whether to display a confirmation dialog when the user attempts to leave the application's page. The default value is true. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_getshowclientconfirmationdialog.html)

methods.name: getStaticResource
methods.docu: In BBj 16.00 and higher, this method returns an existing defined BBjResourceUrl static resource. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_getStaticResource.htm)

methods.name: getStaticResource
methods.docu: In BBj 16.00 and higher, this method returns an existing defined BBjResourceUrl static resource. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_getStaticResource.htm)

methods.name: getStaticResources
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of all defined BBjResourceUrl static resources (style sheets and images). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_getstaticresources.html)

methods.name: getStaticResources
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of all defined BBjResourceUrl static resources (style sheets and images). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_getstaticresources.html)

methods.name: isPublished
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, returns a boolean indicating whether a given BBjApplication is in the set of currently published applications. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_ispublished.html)

methods.name: isRunning
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether the BBjAppServer is currently running. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_isrunning.html)

methods.name: makeEmptyAppConfig
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method returns a new, empty BBjAppConfig to configure a BBjApplication. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_makeemptyappconfig.html)

methods.name: publish
methods.docu: In BBj 12.00 and higher, this method publishes a BBjApplication to the BBjAppServer. This makes the application available to users through the web interface. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_publish.html)

methods.name: removeStaticResource
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, removes a static resource from the set of available static resources.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_removestaticresource.html)

methods.name: setClientPollInterval
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method sets the length of time in seconds the web server will wait for the next command from BBjServices. If the web server does not receive a command from the server in the configured time period, it will send a heartbeat to the browser.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_setclientpollinterval.html)

methods.name: setDevelopmentMode
methods.docu:
In BBj 16.0 and higher, this 
method sets whether BUI apps should be run in development mode by default 
 .[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_setDevelopmentMode.htm)

methods.name: setDisallowConsole
methods.docu:
In BBj 19.10 and higher, this method 
sets whether BUI apps will disallow console access.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_setDisallowConsole.htm)

methods.name: setEndAction
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0 and higher, this method sets the action that will occur on normal application termination.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_setEndAction.html)

methods.name: setErrAction
methods.docu: In BBj 14.0, this method sets the action that will occur on abnormal application termination.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_setErrAction.html)

methods.name: setManageBrowserHistory
methods.docu: In BBj 16.0 and higher, this method sets whether BUI should manage browser history by default. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_setManageBrowserHistory.htm)

methods.name: setOmitBasisCss
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method sets whether BUI apps should be run without 
the default BASIS CSS.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_setOmitBasisCss.htm)

methods.name: setSecure
methods.docu:
In BBj 19.10 and higher, this method sets whether BUI apps should be 
 run in secure mode. The default value is false.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/BBjAppServer_setSecure.htm)

methods.name: setSessionTimeout
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.0 and higher, sets the length of time in seconds a non-responsive 
 BUI session will be considered active. If the session expires without 
 response, the web tier will send a NET_DROPPED error back to the server; 
 -1 corresponds to no timeout.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_setsessiontimeout.html)

methods.name: setShowBrowserWarning
methods.docu:
In BBj 12.0 and higher, sets whether to display a browser warning the 
 first time the user attempts to run a BUI module in Internet Explorer 
 8.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_setshowbrowserwarning.html)

methods.name: setShowClientConfirmationDialog
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, sets whether to display a confirmation dialog when the user attempts to leave the application's page.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_setshowclientconfirmationdialog.html)

methods.name: start
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method starts the BBjAppServer. Any applications published to the BBjAppServer will be accessible. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_start.html)

methods.name: stop
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method stops the BBjAppServer. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_stop.html)

methods.name: unpublish
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method removes the named BBjApplication from the set of published applications. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_unpublish.html)

methods.name: updateApplicationIcon
methods.docu: In BBj 12.0 and higher, this method updates the contents of the icon given by url to contain the contents of the file given by iconFileName. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjappserver/bbjappserver_updateapplicationicon.html)

classes.name: BBjString
classes.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, the BBjString object defines an object-oriented interface to traditional BBx strings. It implements most of the methods defined by java.lang.String. This API is primarily designed to facilitate interaction with Java libraries. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString.htm)

methods.name: charAt
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the char value at the specified index. An index ranges from 0 to BBjString::length() - 1. The first char value of the sequence is at index 0, the next at index 1, and so on, as for array indexing. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_charAt.htm)

methods.name: codePointAt
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method r eturns the character (Unicode code point) at the specified index. The index refers to char values (Unicode code units) and ranges from 0 to BBjString::length() - 1. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_codePointAt.htm)

methods.name: codePointBefore
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method r eturns the character (Unicode code point) before the specified index. The index refers to char values (Unicode code units) and ranges from 1 to BBjString::length(). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_codePointBefore.htm)

methods.name: codePointCount
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, 
 this method returns the 
            number of Unicode code points in the specified text range of this String. 
            The text range begins at the specified beginIndex and extends to the char 
            at index endIndex - 1. Thus the length (in chars) of the text range is 
            endIndex-beginIndex. Unpaired surrogates within the text range count as 
            one code point each.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_codePointCount.htm)

methods.name: compareTo
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method compares two strings lexicographically. The comparison is based on the Unicode value of each character in the strings. The character sequence represented by this String object is compared lexicographically to the character sequence represented by the argument string. The result is a negative integer if this String object lexicographically precedes the argument string. The result is a positive integer if this String object lexicographically follows the argument string. The result is zero if the strings are equal; compareTo returns 0 exactly when the BBjString::equals(Object) method would return true. This is the definition of lexicographic ordering. If two strings are different, then either they have different characters at some index that is a valid index for both strings, or their lengths are different, or both. If they have different characters at one or more index positions, let k be the smallest such index; then the string whose character at position k has the smaller value, as determined by using the < operator, lexicographically precedes the other string. In this case, compareTo returns the difference of the two character values at position k in the two string -- that is, the value: 
this.charAt(k)-anotherString.charAt(k)
If there is no index position at which they differ, then the shorter string lexicographically precedes the longer string. In this case, compareTo returns the difference of the lengths of the strings -- that is, the value: 
this.length()-anotherString.length()
[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_compareTo.htm)

methods.name: compareToIgnoreCase
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method compares two strings lexicographically, ignoring case differences. This method returns an integer whose sign is that of calling BBjString::compareTo(String) with normalized versions of the strings where case differences have been eliminated by calling Character.toLowerCase(Character.toUpperCase(character)) on each character. Note that this method does not take locale into account, and will result in an unsatisfactory ordering for certain locales. The java.text package provides collators to allow locale-sensitive ordering. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_compareToIgnoreCase.htm)

methods.name: concat
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method concatenates the specified string 
 to the end of this string.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_concat.htm)

methods.name: contains
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns true if and only if this 
 string contains the specified sequence of char values.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_contains.htm)

methods.name: contentEquals
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method compares 
this string to the specified CharSequence or StringBuffer. The result 
is true if and only if this String represents the same sequence of char 
values as the specified sequence. Note that if the CharSequence is a StringBuffer 
then the method synchronizes on it.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_contentEquals.htm)

methods.name: contentEquals
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method compares 
this string to the specified CharSequence or StringBuffer. The result 
is true if and only if this String represents the same sequence of char 
values as the specified sequence. Note that if the CharSequence is a StringBuffer 
then the method synchronizes on it.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_contentEquals.htm)

methods.name: endsWith
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method tests if this string ends with the 
 specified suffix.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_endsWith.htm)

methods.name: equals
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method compares this string 
to the specified object. The result is true if and only if the argument 
is not null and is a String object that represents the same sequence of 
characters as this object.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_equals.htm)

methods.name: equalsIgnoreCase
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method compares this String to another String, ignoring case considerations. Two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. Two characters c1 and c2 are considered the same ignoring case if at least one of the following is true:
  • The two characters are the same (as compared by the == operator)
  • Applying the method Character.toUpperCase(char) to each character produces the same result
  • Applying the method Character.toLowerCase(char) to each character produces the same result
[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_equalsIgnoreCase.htm)

methods.name: getBytes
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this 
 method encodes this String into a sequence of bytes 
using the platform's default charset, storing the result into a new byte 
array. The behavior of this method when this string cannot be encoded 
in the default charset is unspecified.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_getBytes.htm)

methods.name: getBytes
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this 
 method encodes this String into a sequence of bytes 
using the platform's default charset, storing the result into a new byte 
array. The behavior of this method when this string cannot be encoded 
in the default charset is unspecified.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_getBytes.htm)

methods.name: getBytes
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this 
 method encodes this String into a sequence of bytes 
using the platform's default charset, storing the result into a new byte 
array. The behavior of this method when this string cannot be encoded 
in the default charset is unspecified.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_getBytes.htm)

methods.name: getChars
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method copies characters from this string into the destination character array.

The first character to be copied is at index srcBegin; the last character to be copied is at index srcEnd-1 (thus the total number of characters to be copied is srcEnd-srcBegin). The characters are copied into the subarray of dst starting at index dstBegin and ending at index:

dstBegin + (srcEnd-srcBegin) - 1 [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_getChars.htm)

methods.name: hashCode
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns a hash code for this string. The hash code for a String object is computed as

s[0]*31^(n-1) + s[1]*31^(n-2) + ... + s[n-1]using int arithmetic, where s[i] is the ith character of the string, n is the length of the string, and ^ indicates exponentiation. (The hash value of the empty string is zero.) [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_hashCode.htm)

methods.name: indent
methods.docu: In BBj 23.04 and higher, this method adjusts the indentation of each line of this string based on the value of n, and normalizes line termination characters.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_indent.htm)

methods.name: indexOf
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the index within this string of the first occurrence of the specified character. If a character with value ch occurs in the character sequence represented by this String object, then the index (in Unicode code units) of the first such occurrence is returned. For values of ch in the range from 0 to 0xFFFF (inclusive), this is the smallest value k such that:is true. For other values of ch, it is the smallest value k such that:

this.charAt(k) == ch

is true. For other values of ch, it is the smallest value k such that:

this.codePointAt(k) == ch

is true. In either case, if no such character occurs in this string, then -1 is returned. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_indexOf.htm)

methods.name: indexOf
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the index within this string of the first occurrence of the specified character. If a character with value ch occurs in the character sequence represented by this String object, then the index (in Unicode code units) of the first such occurrence is returned. For values of ch in the range from 0 to 0xFFFF (inclusive), this is the smallest value k such that:is true. For other values of ch, it is the smallest value k such that:

this.charAt(k) == ch

is true. For other values of ch, it is the smallest value k such that:

this.codePointAt(k) == ch

is true. In either case, if no such character occurs in this string, then -1 is returned. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_indexOf.htm)

methods.name: indexOf
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the index within this string of the first occurrence of the specified character. If a character with value ch occurs in the character sequence represented by this String object, then the index (in Unicode code units) of the first such occurrence is returned. For values of ch in the range from 0 to 0xFFFF (inclusive), this is the smallest value k such that:is true. For other values of ch, it is the smallest value k such that:

methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the index within this string of the first occurrence of the specified character. If a character with value ch occurs in the character sequence represented by this String object, then the index (in Unicode code units) of the first such occurrence is returned. For values of ch in the range from 0 to 0xFFFF (inclusive), this is the smallest value k such that:is true. For other values of ch, it is the smallest value k such that:

this.charAt(k) == ch

is true. For other values of ch, it is the smallest value k such that:

this.codePointAt(k) == ch

is true. In either case, if no such character occurs in this string, then -1 is returned. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_indexOf.htm)

methods.name: intern
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns a canonical representation for the string object. A pool of strings, initially empty, is maintained privately by the class String. When the intern method is invoked, if the pool already contains a string equal to this String object as determined by the BBjString::equals(Object) method, then the string from the pool is returned. Otherwise, this String object is added to the pool and a reference to this String object is returned. It follows that for any two strings s and t, s.intern() == t.intern() is true if and only if s.equals(t) is true. All literal strings and string-valued constant expressions are interned. String literals are defined in section 3.10.5 of the The Java™ Language Specification. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_intern.htm)

methods.name: isBlank
methods.docu: In BBj 23.04 and higher, this method returns true if this string is empty or contains only white space characters, otherwise returns false. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_isBlank.htm)

methods.name: isEmpty
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns true if, and only if BBjString::length() is 0. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_isEmpty.htm)

methods.name: lastIndexOf
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the index within this string of the last occurrence of the specified character. For values of ch in the range from 0 to 0xFFFF (inclusive), the index (in Unicode code units) returned is the largest value k such that: this.charAt(k) == ch is true. For other values of ch, it is the largest value k such that: this.codePointAt(k) == ch is true. In either case, if no such character occurs in this string, then -1 is returned. The String is searched backwards starting at the last character. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_lastIndexOf.htm)

methods.name: lastIndexOf
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the index within this string of the last occurrence of the specified character. For values of ch in the range from 0 to 0xFFFF (inclusive), the index (in Unicode code units) returned is the largest value k such that: this.charAt(k) == ch is true. For other values of ch, it is the largest value k such that: this.codePointAt(k) == ch is true. In either case, if no such character occurs in this string, then -1 is returned. The String is searched backwards starting at the last character. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_lastIndexOf.htm)

methods.name: lastIndexOf
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the index within this string of the last occurrence of the specified character. For values of ch in the range from 0 to 0xFFFF (inclusive), the index (in Unicode code units) returned is the largest value k such that: this.charAt(k) == ch is true. For other values of ch, it is the largest value k such that: this.codePointAt(k) == ch is true. In either case, if no such character occurs in this string, then -1 is returned. The String is searched backwards starting at the last character. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_lastIndexOf.htm)

methods.name: lastIndexOf
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the index within this string of the last occurrence of the specified character. For values of ch in the range from 0 to 0xFFFF (inclusive), the index (in Unicode code units) returned is the largest value k such that: this.charAt(k) == ch is true. For other values of ch, it is the largest value k such that: this.codePointAt(k) == ch is true. In either case, if no such character occurs in this string, then -1 is returned. The String is searched backwards starting at the last character. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_lastIndexOf.htm)

methods.name: length
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns the length of this string. The length is equal to the number of Unicode code units in the string. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_length.htm)

methods.name: matches
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method tells whether or not this string matches the given regular expression. An invocation of this method of the form str.matches(regex) yields exactly the same result as the expression Pattern.matches(regex, str). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_matches.htm)

methods.name: offsetByCodePoints
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this 
 method returns the index within this String that 
is offset from the given index by codePointOffset code points. Unpaired 
surrogates within the text range given by index and codePointOffset count 
as one code point each.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_offsetByCodePoints.htm)

methods.name: regionMatches
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method tests if two string regions are equal.

A substring of this String object is compared to a substring of the argument other. The result is true if these substrings represent identical character sequences. The substring of this String object to be compared begins at index toffset and has length len. The substring of other to be compared begins at index ooffset and has length len. The result is false if and only if at least one of the following is true:

  • toffset is negative.
  • ooffset is negative.
  • toffset+len is greater than the length of this String object.
  • ooffset+len is greater than the length of the other argument.
  • ignoreCase is false and there is some nonnegative integer k less than len such that:
    this.charAt(toffset+k) != other.charAt(ooffset+k)

  • ignoreCase is true and there is some nonnegative integer k less than len such that:
    Character.toLowerCase(this.charAt(toffset+k)) != Character.toLowerCase(other.charAt(ooffset+k))
    and:
    Character.toUpperCase(this.charAt(toffset+k)) != Character.toUpperCase(other.charAt(ooffset+k))

[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_regionMatches.htm)

methods.name: regionMatches
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method tests if two string regions are equal.

A substring of this String object is compared to a substring of the argument other. The result is true if these substrings represent identical character sequences. The substring of this String object to be compared begins at index toffset and has length len. The substring of other to be compared begins at index ooffset and has length len. The result is false if and only if at least one of the following is true:

  • toffset is negative.
  • ooffset is negative.
  • toffset+len is greater than the length of this String object.
  • ooffset+len is greater than the length of the other argument.
  • ignoreCase is false and there is some nonnegative integer k less than len such that:
    this.charAt(toffset+k) != other.charAt(ooffset+k)

  • ignoreCase is true and there is some nonnegative integer k less than len such that:
    Character.toLowerCase(this.charAt(toffset+k)) != Character.toLowerCase(other.charAt(ooffset+k))
    and:
    Character.toUpperCase(this.charAt(toffset+k)) != Character.toUpperCase(other.charAt(ooffset+k))

[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_regionMatches.htm)

methods.name: repeat
methods.docu: In BBj 23.04 and higher, this method returns a string whose value is the concatenation of this string repeated <var>count</var> times. If this string is empty or <var>count</var> is zero then the empty string is returned.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_repeat.htm)

methods.name: replace
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this 
 method replaces each substring of this string that 
matches the literal target sequence with the specified literal replacement 
sequence. The replacement proceeds from the beginning of the string to 
the end, for example, replacing "aa" with "b" in the 
string "aaa" will result in "ba" rather than "ab".[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_replace.htm)

methods.name: replace
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this 
 method replaces each substring of this string that 
matches the literal target sequence with the specified literal replacement 
sequence. The replacement proceeds from the beginning of the string to 
the end, for example, replacing "aa" with "b" in the 
string "aaa" will result in "ba" rather than "ab".[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_replace.htm)

methods.name: replaceAll
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method replaces each substring of this string that matches the given regular expression with the given replacement.

An invocation of this method of the form str.replaceAll(regex, repl) yields exactly the same result as the expression:

Pattern.compile(regex).replaceAll(repl)
Note that backslashes (\) and dollar signs ($) in the replacement string may cause the results to be different than if it were being treated as a literal replacement string; see replaceAll. Use Matcher#quoteReplacement to suppress the special meaning of these characters, if desired. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_replaceAll.htm)

methods.name: replaceFirst
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method replaces the first substring of this string that matches the given regular expression with the given replacement.

An invocation of this method of the form str.replaceFirst(regex, repl) yields exactly the same result as the expression:

compile(regex).matcher(str).replaceFirst(repl)
Note that backslashes (\) and dollar signs ($) in the replacement string may cause the results to be different than if it were being treated as a literal replacement string; see Matcher.replaceFirst. Use Matcher.quoteReplacement to suppress the special meaning of these characters, if desired. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_replaceFirst.htm)

methods.name: split
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method splits this string around matches of the given regular expression. The one-argument method works as if by invoking the two-argument split method with the given expression and a limit argument of zero. Trailing empty strings are therefore not included in the resulting array. The string "boo:and:foo", for example, yields the following results with these expressions:
Regex Result
: {"boo", "and", "foo"}
o {"b", "", ":and:f"}
[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_split.htm)

methods.name: split
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method splits this string around matches of the given regular expression. The one-argument method works as if by invoking the two-argument split method with the given expression and a limit argument of zero. Trailing empty strings are therefore not included in the resulting array. The string "boo:and:foo", for example, yields the following results with these expressions:
Regex Result
: {"boo", "and", "foo"}
o {"b", "", ":and:f"}
[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_split.htm)

methods.name: startsWith
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this 
 method tests if this string starts with the specified prefix.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_startsWith.htm)

methods.name: startsWith
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this 
 method tests if this string starts with the specified prefix.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_startsWith.htm)

methods.name: strip
methods.docu: In BBj 23.04 and higher, this method returns a string whose value is this string, with all leading and trailing white space removed. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_strip.htm)

methods.name: stripIndent
methods.docu: In BBj 23.04 and higher, this method returns a string whose value is this string, with incidental white space removed from the beginning and end of every line. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_stripIndent.htm)

methods.name: stripLeading
methods.docu: In BBj 23.04 and higher, this method returns a string whose value is this string, with all leading white space removed. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_stripLeading.htm)

methods.name: stripTrailing
methods.docu: In BBj 23.04 and higher, this method returns a string whose value is this string, with all trailing white space removed. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_stripTrailing.htm)

methods.name: substring
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this 
 method returns 
 a string that is a substring of this string. The substring begins with 
 the character at the specified index and extends to the end of this string.
                                            Examples:[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_substring.htm)

methods.name: substring
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this 
 method returns 
 a string that is a substring of this string. The substring begins with 
 the character at the specified index and extends to the end of this string.
                                            Examples:[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_substring.htm)

methods.name: subSequence
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns a character sequence that is a subsequence of this sequence.

An invocation of this method of the form:

str.subSequence(begin, end)

behaves in exactly the same way as the invocation:

str.substring(begin, end) [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_subSequence.htm)

methods.name: toCharArray
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this 
 method converts this string to a new character array.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_toCharArray.htm)

methods.name: toLowerCase
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method converts all of the characters in this String to lower case using the rules of the default locale. This is equivalent to calling toLowerCase(Locale.getDefault()). NOTE: This method is locale sensitive, and may produce unexpected results if used for strings that are intended to be interpreted locale independently. Examples are programming language identifiers, protocol keys, and HTML tags. For instance, "TITLE".toLowerCase() in a Turkish locale returns "t\u0131tle", where '\u0131' is the LATIN SMALL LETTER DOTLESS I character. To obtain correct results for locale insensitive strings, use toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_toLowerCase.htm)

methods.name: toLowerCase
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method converts all of the characters in this String to lower case using the rules of the default locale. This is equivalent to calling toLowerCase(Locale.getDefault()). NOTE: This method is locale sensitive, and may produce unexpected results if used for strings that are intended to be interpreted locale independently. Examples are programming language identifiers, protocol keys, and HTML tags. For instance, "TITLE".toLowerCase() in a Turkish locale returns "t\u0131tle", where '\u0131' is the LATIN SMALL LETTER DOTLESS I character. To obtain correct results for locale insensitive strings, use toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_toLowerCase.htm)

methods.name: toUpperCase
methods.docu: In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method converts all of the characters in this String to upper case using the rules of the default locale. This method is equivalent to toUpperCase(Locale.getDefault()). NOTE: This method is locale sensitive, and may produce unexpected results if used for strings that are intended to be interpreted locale independently. Examples are programming language identifiers, protocol keys, and HTML tags. For instance, "title".toUpperCase() in a Turkish locale returns "T\u0130TLE", where '\u0130' is the LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I WITH DOT ABOVE character. To obtain correct results for locale insensitive strings, use toUpperCase(Locale.ROOT). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_toUpperCase.htm)

methods.name: toUpperCase

Examples are programming language identifiers, protocol keys, and HTML tags. For instance, "title".toUpperCase() in a Turkish locale returns "T\u0130TLE", where '\u0130' is the LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I WITH DOT ABOVE character. To obtain correct results for locale insensitive strings, use toUpperCase(Locale.ROOT). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_toUpperCase.htm)

methods.name: translateEscapes
methods.docu: In BBj 23.04 and higher, this method returns a string whose value is this string, with escape sequences translated as if in a Java string literal.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_translateEscapes.htm)

methods.name: trim
methods.docu:
In BBj 7.0 and higher, this method returns a string whose value is this string, with any leading and trailing whitespace removed. If this String object represents an empty character sequence, or the first and last characters of character sequence represented by this String object both have codes greater than '\u0020' (the space character), then a reference to this String object is returned. Otherwise, if there is no character with a code greater than '\u0020' in the string, then a String object representing an empty string is returned.

Otherwise, let k be the index of the first character in the string whose code is greater than '\u0020', and let m be the index of the last character in the string whose code is greater than '\u0020'. A String object is returned, representing the substring of this string that begins with the character at index k and ends with the character at index m-that is, the result of this.substring(k, m + 1). This method may be used to trim whitespace (as defined above) from the beginning and end of a string. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjstring/BBjString_trim.htm)

classes.name: BBjEnterpriseNamespace
classes.docu:
In BBj 13.0 and higher, BBjEnterpriseNamespace provides 
 a mechanism by which two or more BBj programs on the same network can 
 share data. It also provides methods that allow a program to be notified 
 when that shared data is modified by some other program.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjenterprisenamespace/bbjenterprisenamespace.htm)
