classes.name: BBjOpenFileInfo
classes.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, the BBjVector of BBjOpenFileInfo objects provides programmatic access to information about all files open within the current BBjServices environment. It is safe to query this information, but invoking the BBjOpenFileInfo::forceClose method can destabilize your application. This method should be used with extreme caution. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjopenfileinfo/bbjopenfileinfo.htm)

methods.name: forceClose
methods.docu:
In BBj 6.0 and higher, this BBjOpenFileInfo method closes a file that might be held open by some other user. 
NOTE: This method has the potential to crash an application and/or corrupt a database. Use this feature only with extreme caution.
[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjopenfileinfo/bbjopenfileinfo_forceclose.htm)

methods.name: getExtracted
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this BBjOpenFileInfo method returns the byte offset in the file that is currently locked by a BBj user. All getExtracted() values would typically be compared to the value of TCB(10) immediately after receiving an !ERROR=0 attempting to access a record in a file to identify the holder of the lock. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjopenfileinfo/bbjopenfileinfo_getextracted.htm)

methods.name: getFilename
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this BBjOpenFileInfo method returns the name of one of the files currently open in the BBjServices session. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjopenfileinfo/bbjopenfileinfo_getfilename.htm)

methods.name: getHost
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this BBjOpenFileInfo method returns the connected host name for one of the files currently open in the BBjServices session. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjopenfileinfo/bbjopenfileinfo_gethost.htm)

methods.name: getIDString
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this BBjOpenFileInfo method returns the internal ID string for one of the files currently open in the BBjServices session. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjopenfileinfo/bbjopenfileinfo_getidstring.htm)

methods.name: getOpenType
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this BBjOpenFileInfo method returns an integer flag value that indicates how a file in this BBjServices session was opened. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjopenfileinfo/bbjopenfileinfo_getopentype.htm)

methods.name: getOpenTypeString
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this BBjOpenFileInfo method returns a string that indicates how a file in the BBjServices session was opened. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjopenfileinfo/bbjopenfileinfo_getopentypestring.htm)

methods.name: getUser
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this BBjOpenFileInfo method returns the name of the user who opened a given file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjopenfileinfo/bbjopenfileinfo_getuser.htm)

methods.name: isAdvisoryLocking
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this BBjOpenFileInfo method returns whether a given file was opened using advisory locking. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjopenfileinfo/bbjopenfileinfo_isadvisorylocking.htm)

methods.name: isLocked
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this BBjOpenFileInfo method returns whether a given file is locked. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjopenfileinfo/bbjopenfileinfo_islocked.htm)

methods.name: isReadOnly
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this BBjOpenFileInfo method returns whether a given file is opened in read-only mode. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjopenfileinfo/bbjopenfileinfo_isreadonly.htm)

classes.name: BBjJettyContextConfiguration
classes.docu: In BBj 15.00 and higher, this class allows the configuration of web contexts within the Jetty Server. This class is used to programmatically configure these contexts. Each context can contain a unique set of BBxServlets, BUI applications, JNLP application and static content. To access the main BBj context, which is the default context for all applications, use the BBjJettyServerConfiguration::getRootContextInfo() method. The context path is the prefix of a URL path that is used to select the context to which an incoming request is passed. Typically a URL in a BBxServlet is in the format http://hostname:8888/contextPath/servlet/servletPath, where each of the path elements can be zero or more / separated elements. If there is no context path, the context is referred to as the root context. The root context must be configured as '/'. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration.htm)

methods.name: addBBjServlet
methods.docu:
In BBj 15.0 and higher, this method is used to configure a new BBjServlet
 within the current Context.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_addBBjServlet.htm)

methods.name: addBBjspServlet
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method is used to configure a new BBJSP Servlet within the current Context. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_addBBjspServlet.htm)

methods.name: addBBjspServlet
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method is used to configure a new BBJSP Servlet within the current Context. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_addBBjspServlet.htm)

methods.name: addCommandConfig
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method creates a new BBjspCommandConfig representing a BBjspCommand that can be registered with the current BBjJettyContext. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_addCommandConfig.htm)

methods.name: addPipelineConfig
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method creates a new BBjspPipelineConfig representing a BBjspPipeline that will be registered with the current BBjJettyContext. sample BBjAPI/BBjJettyContextConfiguration/addPipelineConfig.bbj [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_addPipelineConfig.htm)

methods.name: deleteCommandConfig
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method deletes the BBjspCommandConfig for the named command in the current BBjJettyContext. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/bbjjettycontextconfiguration_deletecommandconfig.html)

methods.name: deleteHeader
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method deletes the specified header in the current BBjJettyContext. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/bbjjettycontextconfiguration_deleteheader.html)

methods.name: getBBjspServlet
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns the named BBjspServletConfiguration object in the context [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getBBjspServlet.htm)

methods.name: getBBjspServletMappings
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector containing the mapping of all BBjspServlets registered in the context. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getBBjspServletMappings.htm)

methods.name: getBBjspServlets
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector containing BBjspServletConfiguration objects for all the BBJSP Servlets in the context. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/bbjjettycontextconfiguration_getbbjspservlets.htm)

methods.name: getCommandConfig
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjspCommandConfig for the named command in the current BBjJettyContext. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getCommandConfig.htm)

methods.name: getCommandConfigs
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of BBjspCommandConfig records for the current BBjJettyContext. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getCommandConfigs.htm)

methods.name: getDevMode
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method gets the dev-mode of the BBjJettyContext. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/bbjjettycontextconfiguration_getdevmode.html)

methods.name: getEncoding
methods.docu:
In BBj 15.0 and higher, this method gets the encoding for the current
 Context[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getEncoding.htm)

methods.name: getHeader
methods.docu: In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method returns the value bound to the specified header. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/bbjjettycontextconfiguration_getheader.html)

methods.name: getHeaderNames
methods.docu: In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method returns the configured header for the BBjJettyContext. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/bbjjettycontextconfiguration_getheadernames.html)

methods.name: getHttpPort
methods.docu: In BBj 18.0 and higher, this method gets the assigned HTTP port for the BBjJettyContext. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/bbjjettycontextconfiguration_gethttpport.html)

methods.name: getSSLPort
methods.docu: In BBj 21.02 and higher, this method returns the assigned SSL port for this BBjJettyContext, or -1 if the SSL is set to default. If the SSL port is set to default, all SSL ports configured for Jetty will be allowed for secure connections. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getSSLPort.htm)

methods.name: getPipelineConfig
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns the BBjspPipelineConfig for the named BBjspPipeline. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getPipelineConfig.htm)

methods.name: getPipelineConfigs
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of BBjspPipelineConfig records for the current BBjJettyContext. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getPipelineConfigs.htm)

methods.name: getServlet
methods.docu: In BBj 15.00 and higher, this method gets the BBjServletConfiguration for the specified BBj Servlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getServlet.htm)

methods.name: getServletNames
methods.docu: In BBj 15.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector containing the names of all the BBj Servlets in the context. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/bbjjettycontextconfiguration_getservletnames.htm)

methods.name: getServlets
methods.docu: In BBj 15.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector containing BBjServletConfiguration objects for all the BBj Servlet in the context [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getServlets.htm)

methods.name: getSessionStartProgram
methods.docu: In BBj 15.00 and higher, a BBj program can be executed when an HTTP session is created. This method gets the name of the BBj program to be executed when a BBjHttpSession is created [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getSessionStartProgram.htm)

methods.name: getSessionStopProgram
methods.docu: In BBj 15.00 and higher, a BBj program can be executed when an HTTP session is created. This method gets the name of the BBj program to be executed when a BBjHttpSession terminates [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getSessionStopProgram.htm)

methods.name: getStatus
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method gets the status of the BBjJettyContext. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getStatus.htm)

methods.name: putCommandConfig
methods.docu: In BBj 17.00 and higher, this method puts the BBjspCommandConfig in the configuration file for the BBjJettyContext and registers the new BBjspCommand for immediate use. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_putCommandConfig.htm)

methods.name: removeBBjServlet
methods.docu:
In BBj 15.00 and higher, this method removes a BBjServlet from a Jetty
 Context[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_removeBBjServlet.htm)

methods.name: setClasspath
methods.docu:
In BBj 15.0 and higher, this method sets the Session-specific Classpath 
 (SSCP) to use[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_setClasspath.htm)

methods.name: setSSLPort
methods.docu: In BBj 21.02 and higher, this method assigns the SSL port for this BBjJettyContext. Valid values for this method are any SSL ports that have been configured for Jetty, or -1 for the default value. If the SSL port is set to default, all SSL ports configured for Jetty will be allowed for secure connections. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_setSSLPort.htm)

methods.name: setSessionStartProgram
methods.docu: In BBj 15.00 and higher, a BBj program can be executed when an HTTP session is created. This method sets the name of the BBj program to be executed when a BBjHttpSession is created [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_setSessionStartProgram.htm)

methods.name: setSessionStopProgram
methods.docu: In BBj 15.00 and higher, a BBj program can be executed when an HTTP session terminates. This method sets the name of the BBj program to be executed when a BBjHttpSession terminates [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_setSessionStopProgram.htm)

methods.name: removeBBjspServlet
methods.docu: In BBj 18.00 and higher, this method removes a BBjsp Servlet from the current BBjJettyContext. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/bbjjettycontextconfiguration_removebbjspservlet.html)

methods.name: getCommandExtensions
methods.docu: In BBj 18.11 and higher, this method gets a comma-separated list of extensions that are associated with BBjspCommands. If BBjspCommands are disabled, then this method will return null. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/bbjjettycontextconfiguration_getcommandextensions.htm)

methods.name: addBBxServlet
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method adds a BBxServlet to the BBjJettyContextConfiguration and returns the added BBxServlet. Throws a BBjException if the servlet cannot be added. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_addBBxServlet.htm)

methods.name: addBBxServlet

[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_addBBxServlet.htm)

methods.name: addBBxServlet
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method adds a BBxServlet to the BBjJettyContextConfiguration and returns the added BBxServlet. Throws a BBjException if the servlet cannot be added. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_addBBxServlet.htm)

methods.name: addBBxServlet
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method adds a BBxServlet to the BBjJettyContextConfiguration and returns the added BBxServlet. Throws a BBjException if the servlet cannot be added. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_addBBxServlet.htm)

methods.name: addBBxServlet
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method adds a BBxServlet to the BBjJettyContextConfiguration and returns the added BBxServlet. Throws a BBjException if the servlet cannot be added. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_addBBxServlet.htm)

methods.name: getBBxServlet
methods.docu: In BBj 21.0 and higher, this method returns the BBxServlet at the specified mapping. Throws a BBjException if the mapping does not exist. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getBBxServlet.htm)

methods.name: getBBxServlets
methods.docu: In BBj 21.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of all of the BBxServlets registered in this BBjJettyContextConfiguration. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getBBxServlets.htm)

methods.name: getBBxServletMappings
methods.docu: In BBj 21.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of the mapping strings for each BBxServlet registered in this BBjJettyContextConfiguration. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_getBBxServletMappings.htm)

methods.name: removeBBxServlet
methods.docu: In BBj 21.0 and higher, this method removes the servlet identified by the specified mapping from the BBjJettyContextConfiguration. Throws a BBjException if the mapping does not exist. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettycontextconfiguration/BBjJettyContextConfiguration_removeBBxServlet.htm)

classes.name: BBjEventData
classes.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, BBjEventData provides 
access to the data generated by a configured event handler.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjeventdata/BBjEventData.htm)

methods.name: getEventName
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns the short descriptive name of the 
event that occurred.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjeventdata/BBjEventData_getEventName.htm)

methods.name: getEventType
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method 
            returns a numeric type identifier for the 
            event.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjeventdata/BBjEventData_getEventType.htm)

methods.name: getEventId
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns 
            a unique identifier for the event
            .[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjeventdata/BBjEventData_getEventId.htm)

methods.name: getEventTypeName
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, returns a string 
            name for the type of event that occurred.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjeventdata/BBjEventData_getEventTypeName.htm)

methods.name: getEventDetail
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns 
            a detailed string containing information about the event that occurred. 
            Each event type may return a string of a different format depending on 
            the type of information available from the event.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjeventdata/BBjEventData_getEventDetail.htm)

classes.name: BBjBuiUrlCloseAction
classes.docu:
In BBj 14.00 and higher, the BBjBuiUrlCloseAction object provides an interface to chain to a specific URL on termination of a BUI or DWC application.
                                            <div class="note">[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiUrlCloseAction/BBjBuiUrlCloseAction.html)

methods.name: getActionType
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns an integer constant identifying the type of this close action (ACTION_URL). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiUrlCloseAction/BBjBuiUrlCloseAction_getActionType.htm)

methods.name: getActionTypeString
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns an string constant identifying the type of this close action (ACTION_URL). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiUrlCloseAction/BBjBuiUrlCloseAction_getActionTypeString.htm)

methods.name: getUrl
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns the URL from this close action.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiUrlCloseAction/bbjbuiurlcloseaction_geturl.htm)

classes.name: BBjBuiDefaultCloseAction
classes.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, the BBjBuiDefaultCloseAction object provides an interface to select the default close action of a BUI or DWC application.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiDefaultCloseAction/BBjBuiDefaultCloseAction.htm)

methods.name: getActionType
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns an integer constant identifying the type of this close action (ACTION_DEFAULT). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiDefaultCloseAction/BBjBuiDefaultCloseAction_getActionType.htm)

methods.name: getActionTypeString
methods.docu: In BBj 14.00 and higher, this method returns an string constant identifying the type of this close action (ACTION_DEFAULT). [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bui/BBjBuiDefaultCloseAction/BBjBuiDefaultCloseAction_getActionTypeString.htm)

classes.name: BBjFileSystem
classes.docu: The BBjFileSystem provides methods for interacting with the filesystem.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/BBjFileSystem.htm)

methods.name: getAddrCount
methods.docu: In BBj 2.01 and higher, this method returns the number of public programs loaded into memory as resident programs via the ADDR verb. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/bbjfilesystem_getaddrcount.htm)

methods.name: getCachedCount
methods.docu: In BBj 2.01 and higher, this method returns the number of programs currently within the program cache.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/bbjfilesystem_getcachedcount.htm)

methods.name: convertMKeyedToXKeyed
methods.docu: Converts a MKEYED file into an XKEYED file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/bbjfilesystem_convertmkeyedtoxkeyed.htm)

methods.name: convertMKeyedToXKeyed
methods.docu: Converts a MKEYED file into an XKEYED file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/bbjfilesystem_convertmkeyedtoxkeyed.htm)

methods.name: convertMKeyedToXKeyed
methods.docu: Converts a MKEYED file into an XKEYED file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/bbjfilesystem_convertmkeyedtoxkeyed.htm)

methods.name: recoverFile
methods.docu: Rebuilds any recoverable file type based on the internal recovery information contained within the file. This includes MKEYED, XKEYED, and VKEYED file types. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/bbjfilesystem_recoverfile.htm)

methods.name: recoverFile
methods.docu: Rebuilds any recoverable file type based on the internal recovery information contained within the file. This includes MKEYED, XKEYED, and VKEYED file types. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/bbjfilesystem_recoverfile.htm)

methods.name: recoverFile
methods.docu: Rebuilds any recoverable file type based on the internal recovery information contained within the file. This includes MKEYED, XKEYED, and VKEYED file types. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/bbjfilesystem_recoverfile.htm)

methods.name: getFileInfo
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjFileInfo object that is associated with an open file channel. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/bbjfilesystem_getfileinfo.htm)

methods.name: makeKeySegment
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method creates a BBjKeySegment object. BBjKeySegment objects are used to construct BBjKeyInfo objects, which can be used to manipulate VKEYED file key chains dynamically. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/bbjfilesystem_makekeysegment.htm)

methods.name: makeKeyInfo
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method creates a BBjKeyInfo object.The BBjKeyInfo object can be used to manipulate VKEYED file key chains dynamically. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/bbjfilesystem_makekeyinfo.htm)

methods.name: makeKeyInfo
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method creates a BBjKeyInfo object.The BBjKeyInfo object can be used to manipulate VKEYED file key chains dynamically. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/bbjfilesystem_makekeyinfo.htm)

methods.name: getTriggerData
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns the BBjTriggerData object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/bbjfilesystem_gettriggerdata.htm)

methods.name: getStoredProcedureData
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns the BBjStoredProcedureData object. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/bbjfilesystem_getstoredproceduredata.htm)

methods.name: resolvePath
methods.docu:
In BBj 15.0 and higher, this method returns the fully resolved absolute 
 path for the specified file name. The file name can be a file relative 
 to any configured prefix configurations. When a BBx program makes a call 
 to OPEN passing in a relative path to a file, BBj checks any configured 
 prefixes to look for the specified file in those locations. This method 
 returns the full path BBj would use in a call to OPEN.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/BBjFileSystem_resolvePath.htm)

methods.name: getMimeType
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns the detected MIME type for the specified filename. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/BBjFileSystem_getMimeType.htm)

methods.name: getInputStream
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns a Java InputStream for the specified filename. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/BBjFileSystem_getInputStream.htm)

methods.name: getOutputStream
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns a Java OutputStream for the specified filename. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/BBjFileSystem_getOutputStream.htm)

methods.name: watchDirectory
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method watches the specified directory 
for changes (create, modify, delete), periodically reporting any changes 
through the specified callback.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/BBjFileSystem_watchDirectory.htm)

methods.name: watchDirectory
methods.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method watches the specified directory 
for changes (create, modify, delete), periodically reporting any changes 
through the specified callback.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/BBjFileSystem_watchDirectory.htm)

methods.name: unwatchDirectory
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method stops watching the specified directory for changes (create, modify, delete). This directory must have been previously watched using BBjFileSystem::watchDirectory. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/BBjFileSystem_unwatchDirectory.htm)

methods.name: unwatchAllDirectories
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method stops watching all directories currently being watched with BBjFileSystem::watchDirectory. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/FileSystem/bbjfilesystem/BBjFileSystem_unwatchAllDirectories.htm)

classes.name: BBjJavaServletConfiguration
classes.docu:
In BBj 15.0 and higher, the JavaServletConfiguration is used to configure 
 a Java based servlet within a context.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjavaservletconfiguration/BBjJavaServletConfiguration.htm)

methods.name: getClassName
methods.docu:
In BBj 15.0 and higher, this method returns the name of the class which 
 was deployed as a servlet. The class name will be the fully-qualified 
 name of a class which includes the package.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjavaservletconfiguration/BBjJavaServletConfiguration_getClassName.htm)

classes.name: BBjErrorInfo
classes.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, the BBjErrorInfo object encapsulates assorted 
 error information from a specific instant in time, typically captured 
 in an error handler.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjerrorinfo/BBjErrorInfo.htm)

methods.name: getErr
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns the value of the ERR variable at the moment when this BBjErrorInfo object was captured. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjerrorinfo/BBjErrorInfo_getErr.htm)

methods.name: getErrLine
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns the value of TCB(5) at the moment when this BBjErrorInfo object was captured. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjerrorinfo/BBjErrorInfo_getErrLine.htm)

methods.name: getErrMes
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns the value of ERRMES(1-) at the moment when this BBjErrorInfo object was captured. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjerrorinfo/BBjErrorInfo_getErrMes.htm)

methods.name: getHostErr
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns the value of TCB(10) at the moment when this BBjErrorInfo object was captured. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjerrorinfo/BBjErrorInfo_getHostErr.htm)

methods.name: getLevel
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns the value of TCB(13) at the moment when this BBjErrorInfo object was captured. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjerrorinfo/BBjErrorInfo_getLevel.htm)

methods.name: getProgram
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns the value of PGM(-2) at the moment when this BBjErrorInfo object was captured. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjerrorinfo/BBjErrorInfo_getProgram.htm)

methods.name: getStatement
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns the value of PGM(TCB(5)) at the moment when this BBjErrorInfo object was captured. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/API/bbjerrorinfo/BBjErrorInfo_getStatement.htm)

classes.name: BBjMDI
classes.docu:
In BBj 3.0 and higher, the BBjMDI object represents an MDI (Multiple 
 Document Interface) window used to display all windows created by an application 
 being run through a thin client. The BBjMDI aggregates an internal BBjTopLevelWindow.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjmdi/bbjmdi.htm)

methods.name: createMDIWindow
methods.docu:
Creates the BBjMDI window used by the process. The act of creating a BBjMDI window has an effect on the manner in which new SCALLed versions of BBj display. If the program that has created a BBjMDI window makes a call of the form:

   X = SCALL("bbj ...<someProgram> ....&) Any windows created by <someProgram> display within the user area of the BBjMDI window. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjmdi/bbjmdi_createmdiwindow.htm)

methods.name: createMDIWindow
methods.docu:
Creates the BBjMDI window used by the process. The act of creating a BBjMDI window has an effect on the manner in which new SCALLed versions of BBj display. If the program that has created a BBjMDI window makes a call of the form:

   X = SCALL("bbj ...<someProgram> ....&) Any windows created by <someProgram> display within the user area of the BBjMDI window. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjmdi/bbjmdi_createmdiwindow.htm)

methods.name: createMDIWindow
methods.docu:
Creates the BBjMDI window used by the process. The act of creating a BBjMDI window has an effect on the manner in which new SCALLed versions of BBj display. If the program that has created a BBjMDI window makes a call of the form:

   X = SCALL("bbj ...<someProgram> ....&) Any windows created by <someProgram> display within the user area of the BBjMDI window. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjmdi/bbjmdi_createmdiwindow.htm)

methods.name: getForwardMenuAccelerators
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method returns a value describing whether the window argument will forward keystrokes to the BBjMDI parent for consideration as menu accelerators. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjmdi/bbjmdi_getforwardmenuaccelerators.htm)

methods.name: setForwardMenuAccelerators
methods.docu: In BBj 6.0 and higher, this method configures whether keystrokes are forwarded by the window argument to the BBjMDI parent window for menu accelerator consideration. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjmdi/bbjmdi_setforwardmenuaccelerators.htm)

methods.name: setDefaultMDIMode
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method sets the default MDIMode that will be used when new BBjSessions are launched within this MDI.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjmdi/bbjmdi_setdefaultmdimode.htm)

methods.name: getDefaultMDIMode
methods.docu: In BBj 9.0 and higher, this method returns the default MDIMode that will be used when new BBjSessions are launched within this MDI.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/bbjmdi/bbjmdi_getdefaultmdimode.htm)

classes.name: BBjJettyServer
classes.docu:
In BBj 17.0 and higher, this class provides an administrator program the
 ability to control the running BBJ Web Server.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserver/BBjJettyServer.htm)

methods.name: isRunning
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns a boolean value that indicates whether the Jetty server is running. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserver/BBjJettyServer_isRunning.htm)

methods.name: start
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method will start the integrated Jetty Server. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserver/BBjJettyServer_start.htm)

methods.name: stop
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method will stop the integrated Jetty Server. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserver/BBjJettyServer_stop.htm)

methods.name: restart
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method will restart the integrated Jetty Server. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserver/BBjJettyServer_restart.htm)

methods.name: getContextNames
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector containing the names of the configured contexts within the integrated Jetty Server. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserver/BBjJettyServer_getContextNames.htm)

methods.name: getContext
methods.docu: In BBj 17.0 and higher, this method returns a BBjJettyContextController that can control a running context within the integrated Jetty Server. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/admin/bbjjettyserver/BBjJettyServer_getContext.htm)
